Let X = {x1, x2 ..... xn} be a set of n real valued points on the number line (not necessarily sorted).
An internal [x, x + 2] can be placed starting at any point x ∈ X, and covers all points within that
range. We have to cover all points in X using the minimum number of such internals.
Greedy algorithm works:
While there are uncovered points.
Choose the leftmost uncovered point xi
Place an internal starting at xi → covers [xi, xi + 2].
S1 : X = [0.9, 1.1, 2.5, 2.7, 4.2, 4.9, 6.1, 6.8], the algorithm places 3 intervals to cover all points.
S2 : T(n) = Ο(n log n) for unsorted array, Ο(n) for sorted array.
S3 : If we replace [x, x + 2] with a symmetric interval [x – 1, x + 1], the greedy strategy needs to be
changed to pick rightmost point within range instead of leftmost.

  1. Only S1 and S3 are true
  2. Only S1 is true
  3. S2 and S3 are true
  4. S1, S2 and S3 are true

  1. Less than 1
  2. Less than n
  3. Less than m

Which of the following statement(s) is/are true?

  1. Quicksort and merge sort are both examples of divide and conquer algorithms.

  2. If we randomly choose a pivot element each time, quicksort will always terminate in time Ο(n log n).

  3. For every fixed strategy to choose a pivot for quicksort, we can construct a worst case input that requires time Ο(n).

  4. If we could find the median in time Ο(1), quicksort would have worst case complexity Ο(n log n).

Read the passage carefully and answer the following question.
Child psychology is certainly not a strong point with most Indian schools; why else would they inflict a double trauma on a student performing badly in the pre-boards by banning her from taking the board exams. Often with fatal results as evidenced by reports of student suicides in the run-up to the boards. Now the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has stepped in and put the brakes on this discriminatory practice, ruling that no student can be barred from the Boards without prior clearance from the CBSE. This is good news for parents and students, many of whom have had to live with the threat of performance-linked debarment. While the school’s logic is that in order to attract talented students, they need to maintain their performance records at high levels. Chances are that a student faring poorly at the pre-boards will replicate at the boards is faulty. Chances are that the student will be spurred to work doubly hard. On the other hand, the threat of debarment, will almost certainly impact adversely on his/her performance. Of course, linking pre-boards to the boards is only one of the problems with our school system.
Which is the good news for parents, according to the passage?

  1. School will take the responsibility of preparing students for the board.
  2. School will provide study facilities to the poor student.
  3. Schools will enforce discipline to ensure higher attendance of students.
  4. No students can be barred from the Boards without prior clearance from the CBSE.

Suppose b1, b2, b3, ... is a sequence defined by b1 = 3, b2 = 6, bk = bk – 2 + bk – 1 for k ≥ 3. Prove that bn is divisible by 3 for all integers n ≥ 1. Regarding the induction hypothesis, which is true?

  1. Assuming this statement is true for k ≤ n is enough to show that it is true for n + 1 and no weaker assumption will do.

  2. Assuming this statement is true for n and n – 1 is enough to show that it is true for n + 1.

  3. Assuming this statement is true for n, n – 1, and n – 3 is enough to show that it is true for n + 1 and no weaker assumption will do since you need three consecutive integers to insure divisibility by 3.

  3. S3 and S4

  3. The data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question;
  4. The data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

Read the passage carefully and choose the best answer to the following question from the four alternatives given below.
In the past 50 years, doctors across the world have accepted the practice to prescribe antibiotics at the first sign of a trivial infection or treat patients with a handful of antibiotics. These days it is not uncommon to see practitioners prescribing multiple antibiotics without any real indication or relevance for such a combination of drugs. Antibiotics have traditionally been known as miracle drugs, but there is growing evidence that they are overworked miracles, especially in countries like ours where there is easy access to drugs across the counter, including antibiotics. We cannot think of a return to pre-antibiotic days. Yet the unbridled use of these agents is inexorably propelling us in that direction.
Antibiotics are called overworked miracles because:

  1. they performed miracles.
  2. they are hardly used.
  3. they are over-used.
  4. they exhausted their miracles.

Read the passage carefully and answer the following question.
Among Nature’s most intriguing phenomena are the partnerships formed by many different species. The name used for these relationships, Symbiosis, comes from Greek meaning “living together”. Not all symbiotic relationships are the same. There are some called commensal relationships, in which one partner gains a benefit while the other gains little or none but is not
harmed. One example is the relationship between two types of fish – remoras and sharks. The remora, which is long and often striped, attaches itself to a shark (sometimes to another type of fish or a whale), using a sucker on its head. When the shark makes a kill, the hitchhiker briefly detaches itself to feed on the scraps. Another type of symbiotic relationship is parasitism, in which one partner benefits at the expense of others. Ticks and tapeworms are among familiar parasites.
The third type of symbiotic relationship, called mutualism, is a true partnership in which both partners benefit. The relationship may be limited as when zebras and wildebeest graze together on the vast African grasslands. Each species can survive on its own, but together their chances of detecting predators are improved because each contributes a specially keen sense. (Zebras have
the better eyesight; wildebeest, hearing and sense of smell). In a few cases, partners are so interdependent that one cannot survive without the other. Most mutualistic relationships probably lie somewhere in between.
The passage talks about how animals

  1. attack/prey each other
  2. live together mutual dependance
  3. take advantage of the weaker ones
  4. are independent of each other

Which of the above statement is correct?

  1. Only S1
  2. Only S2
  3. Neither S1 nor S2
  4. Both S1 and S2

Which of the following statements are TRUE?

  1. Size of any pointer variable takes same bytes of memory irrespective it’s data type.
  2. While assigning address of any type of variable to a void pointer mandatorily requires type casting otherwise it will give error.
  3. Array name without subscript ([ ]) always gives constant base address which cannot be modified.
  4. A pointer initialized with “NULL”, upon dereferencing will give segmentation error.

Consider a 6 stages instruction pipeline, where all stages are perfectly balanced. Assume that there is no cycle time overhead of pipelining. When application is executed on 6 stage pipeline, then how many instruction incur 4 pipeline stalls cycles if the speedup achieved with respect to
non-pipeline is 4 ________ (in %). (Upto 1 decimal place)

  1. 12.5

A language uses an alphabet of six letters, {a, b, c, d, e, f}. The relative frequency of use of each letter of the alphabet in the language is as given below:

 
 
What would be the average length of the encoded words of the language using Huffman code?
  1. 2.33

Consider the following languages:

 
Which of the above statements are not correct?
  1. Only S1 and S4
  2. Only S2, S3 and S4
  3. Only S1, S2 and S4
  4. Only S2 and S3

Consider the following statements and select the statements which is/are true?

  1. Unintialized pointers are known as wild pointers because they point to some arbitrary memory location and may cause a program to crash or behave badly.
  2. Static scoping execute faster than dynamic scoping in general.
  3. A pointer to a memory location that has been deleted (or fixed) is called dangling pointer.
  4. In switch case two case labels can have same value.

Consider the partially ordered set (P(S), ⊇) where S = {1, 2, 3, 4, ....., 256}. Let A, B, C and D be subsets of S such that A contains all multiples of 8, and B contains multiples of 12, C consists of multiples of 18 and D consists of all perfect squares respectively.
Then the cardinality of LUB(LUB(A, B), LUB(B, C)) is equal to ________.

  1. 3

The probability mass function of an random variable X is given as

 
 
If a = 0.6, then variance of X is ________.
  1. 0
  2. 0.36
  3. 0.24
  4. 0.76

Inter process communication between two end systems in network not possible with

  1. TCP sockets
  2. BSD Sockets
  3. Pipes (Unix)
  4. None of these

A disk has 201 cylinders, numbered from 0 to 200. At some time, disk arm is at cylinder 100 and there is a queue of disk access request for cylinders 15, 60, 90, 135, 165, 180.
Suppose:
I. A seek time takes 1 msec per cylinder to move the disk arm.
II. Directly moving the disk arm from the outermost of the disk (with the largest cylinder number) to the innermost of the disk (without servicing any disk request) takes only 10 msec.
III. Initially, the disk arm is moving towards higher cylinders.
The seek time needed to serve the above requests if the C-scan disk scheduling algorithms is used is _______ msec.

  1. 200

Consider a 5 stage pipelined processor having stages: Instruction fetch (IF), Instruction decode (ID), Operand fetch (OF), Execute (EX), Write back (WB). The IF, ID, OF, WB stages take 1 clock cycle each for any instruction. The EX stage takes 1 clock cycle for ADD and SUB instructions, 3 clock cycles for MUL instructions and 6 clock cycles for DIV instruction. Operand forwarding is used in the pipeline (for data dependency, OF stage of the dependent instruction can be executed only after the previous instruction completed EX). What is number of clock cycles needed to execute the following sequence of instructions?
MUL: R2, R0, R1
DIV: R5, R3, R4
ADD: R2, R5, R2
SUB: R5, R2, R6

  1. 15

A priority-queue is implemented as a max-heap. Initially, it has 5 elements. The level order traversal of the heap is given below:
10, 8, 5, 3, 2
Two new elements “1” and “7” are inserted in the heap in that order. The level-order traversal of the heap after the insertion of the elements is

  1. 10, 8, 7, 3, 2, 1, 5
  2. 10, 8, 7, 1, 2, 3, 5
  3. 10, 8, 7, 2, 3, 1, 5
  4. 10, 8, 7, 5, 3, 2, 1

Which of the following CFG will represents the above language
  3. Both (a) and (b)
  4. None of these

Consider directed graphs on 4 labelled vertices {1, 2, 3, 4} where each vertex has exactly one edge coming in and exactly one edge going out. Self-loops are allowed. How many graphs have exactly two cycles?

  1. 11

The probability of a man hitting the target is  Then the number of times, he must fire so that the probability of his hitting the target atleast once, is more than 90% is ________. (Round off the answer to the next nearest integer)

  1. 6

Which of the following statements is/are correct?

  1. Contiguous allocation suffers only from external fragmentation but not internal fragmentation.
  2. Linked allocation suffers from external fragmentation.
  3. In linked allocation, if any pointer in the chain is corrupted or lost, the file cannot be accessed beyond that block, leading to the loss of all subsequent data.
  4. indexed allocation, the pointer overhead is greater than in linked allocation.

The following function reverse( ) is supposed to reverse a singly linked list. There is one line missing at the end of the function.

 
What should be added in place of “/*ADD A STATEMENT HERE*/”, so that the function correctly reverses a linked list.
  1. *head_ref = NULL;
  2. *head_ref = next;
  3. *head_ref = current;
  4. *head_ref = prev;

Consider the following statements is/are correct?

  1. In sorted file organization, records are stored sequentially, enabling efficient scans with minimal I/O overhead.
  2. A sparse index stores entries for only some search key values, reducing index size but requiring sequential search with data blocks.
  3. A dense index stores an entry search key value enabling direct access but decreasing index size.
  4. None of these

Consider a circuit given below with initial state Q3 Q2 Q1 Q0 as 1010.

 
 
The number of clock pulses required to get the initial state again are
 
  1. 4
  2. 5
  3. 8
  4. 10

  1. P-II, Q-I, R-III
  2. P-I, Q-II, R-III
  3. P-III, Q-II, R-I
  4. P-III, Q-I, R-II

Conversion of application TCP message in to segments and then in to packets is done when the data is transmitted from client to Server?

  1. Sender computer only
  2. Sender computer followed by router
  3. Only by routers
  4. None of these

Which of the following statements is TRUE?

  1. Malloc( ) always returns integer pointer in all situations.
  2. Static variable scope is entire program
  3. STACK cannot be implemented by using linked list.
  4. None of the above

Consider the following 4 stages instruction pipeline where different instructions are spending different amount of time at different stages.

 
How many cycles are overlapped between the iterations?
  1. 7

Consider the following schedule:

  1. Schedule (S) is allowed 2PL.
  2. Schedule (S) is not allowed 2PL.
  3. Schedule (S) is strict recoverable.
  4. Schedule (S) is not strict recoverable.

Consider the following resource allocation graph of a system with P0, P1, P2 and P3 processes, and R0, R1, R2 and R3 resources.

 
 
Small circle in rectangle shows instance of that resource. So, R0, R1 and R3 have single instances and R2 has two instances. Consider the following statements for above resource allocation graph of system:
S1 : System is in deadlock.
S2 : Cycle in resource allocation graph is sufficient to detect deadlock in system with multiple instance for resources.
S3 : If process “P1” from above system is aborted/terminated and release its allocated resources, then system will be free from deadlock.
Which of above statements is/are correct?
  1. S1 only
  2. S1 and S3 only
  3. S2 and S3 only
  4. S1, S2 and S3

Consider the following augmented grammar G:

 
Which of the following is correct about construction of LR(1) parser of grammar G?
  1. 2 states contain RR conflicts
  2. 2 states contain SR conflicts
  3. 3 states contain SR conflicts
  4. None of these

Consider the following statements about computing out-degree of every vertex in a Graph G:
I. Given an adjacency-list representation of a directed graph G = (V, E), it takes Θ(V + E) time to
compute the out-degree of every vertex without any additional storage.
II. Given an adjacency-list representation of a directed graph G = (V, E), it takes Θ(V) time to
compute the out-degree of every vertex with Θ(V) additional storage.
Which of the above is correct?

  1. I only
  2. II only
  3. Both I and II
  4. None of these

Consider following instance of relation schemas 

 
Number of tuples return by above query is ________.
  1. 4

Which of the following statement is not true regarding interrupts?

  1. External or hardware interrupt a raised due to timing and I/O devices.
  2. Software interrupt a raised due to switching from user to system mode or vice-versa.
  3. Internal interrupt a raised due to incorrect use of instructions and data.
  4. Division by zero, register overflow, invalid opcode are external interrupts.

questions.text:
A train travels at a original speed for a distance of 63 km and then travels a distance of 72 km at an average speed of 6 km/hr more than its original speed. If it takes 3 hours to complete the total journey, what is the original speed of the train in km/hr?

  1. 24
  2. 33
  3. 42
  4. 66

60 g of sugar was mixed in 360 water in a vessel A, 80 g of sugar was mixed in 560 ml of water in vessel B and 40 g of sugar was mixed in 200 ml of water in vessel C. The solution in vessel B is

  1. Sweeter than that in C

  2. Sweeter than that in A

  3. As sweet as that in C

  4. Less sweet than that in C

The two pie charts below show the percentage market share on value basis of the companies A to E in a sectorial market for 1999 and 2000.

Which company had the minimum growth rate in sales in these two years?

  1. B
  2. A
  3. D
  4. E

A survey was conducted on a sample of 1000 persons with reference to their knowledge of English, French and German. The results of the survey are presented in the given Venn diagram. The ratio of the number of persons who do not know any of the three languages to those who know all the three languages is

In how many maximum different ways can 3 identical balls be placed in the 12 squares (each ball to be placed in the exact centre of the squares and only one ball is to be placed in one square) shown in the figure given below such that they do not lie along the same straight line?

  1. 144
  2. 204
  3. 200
  4. 216

  2. Despite of them

  4. Despite off their

Something that can not be imitated.

  1. Inimitable
  2. Inevitable
  3. Duplicity
  4. Inexplicable

Ratio of perimeter of circumscribed circle to inscribed circle about a square is

  2. 2

Consider the following statements:
S1 : Worst case time complexity for searching in binary search tree with n nodes is Ο(n).
S2 : Worst case time complexity for searching in AVL tree with n nodes is Ο(log n).
S3 : Worst case time complexity for searching in binary heap with n nodes is Ο(log n).
Which statements are correct?

  1. S2 only

  2. S2 and S3 only

  3. S1 and S2 only

  4. S3 only

  2. (0 + 1)* 01 is expression equivalent to L(G).

  3. G generates all strings end with 01.

  4. L(G) is a regular language.

Which of the following is true?

  1. Static variable scope is within the body.
  2. Inorder traversal of binary tree is always sorted order.
  3. Postfix evaluation uses operator stack.
  4. Queue cannot be implemented using linked list.

Which of the following is incorrect for a max binary heap tree T (distinct keys)?

  2. Second smallest element is always at leaf.
  3. Second largest element is always a child of root.
  4. Smallest element is always at leaf.

  1. 192

(ii) Merge sort
(iii) Quick sort
(iv) Heap sort

  1. Only (ii)
  2. Only (ii) and (iii)
  3. Only (i) and (iii)

Consider a LAN with 5 nodes N1, N2, N3, N4 and N5. There is a fixed-size slot timing in he network. Any node can begin its transmission only at the beginning of its slot. The probability of transmission of frame in its time slot for N1, N2, N3, N4 and N5 0.4, 0.4, 0.4, 0.4 and 0.4 respectively.
What is the probability of sending a frame in the first slot without any collision ______. [Upto 2 decimal place] By any station.

  1. 0.25 [0.25 - 0.27]

Consider the following sequence of micro-instruction in a control unit:

where MAR is memory address register, MBR is memory buffer register, R1 is general purpose register and IR (address) is value of address field in instruction register IR. The operation performed by above sequence of micro-instructions is

  1. Load operand at address IR (address) to register R1.

  2. Add operand at address IR (address) to register R1.

  3. Add address value in IR (address) to register R1.

  4. Store address IR (address) in memory and MBR to register R1.

Consider the following undirected simple graph G′ :

  1. One Depth-First-Search (DFS) order of G′ is A, B, G, C, F, E, D.
  2. One Breadth-First-Search (BFS) order of G′ is A, B, C, E, G, F, D.
  3. With A as source node, in all possible DFS tree of G′ , B is always parent of either G or D.
  4. With A as source node, in all possible BFS tree of G′ , distance of G′ from A is same.

A packet addressed to a destination address 200.150.68.118 arrives at the router. It will be forwarded to the interface with ID ________.

Which of the following are correct?

  1. User level threads requires hardware support.
  2. A user thread of a process can be in running state while this process in ready state.
  3. Kernel threads are independent threads.
  4. A process transit from running state to ready state is a preemptive transition.

When a processor issue a command to DMA module, which of the following informations provided by processor to DMA module?

  1. Address of device.

  2. The number of words to be read or write.
  3. The starting location in memory to read from or write to.
  4. The request is read or write.

I. Given an adjacency-list representation of a directed graph G = (V, E), it takes time to compute the out-degree of every vertex without any additional storage.
II. Given an adjacency-list representation of a directed graph G = (V, E), it takes time to compute the out-degree of every vertex with additional storage.
Which of the above is correct?

  1. I only
  2. II only
  3. Both I and II
  4. None of these

The number of states in the minimal deterministic finite automata corresponding to the regular expression (0 + 1)* (000 + 001) is ________.

  1. 5

The number of spanning trees possible for a labelled undirected complete graph with 4 nodes is ________.

Which of the following statements is/are INCORRECT about the OSPF (Open Shortest Path First) routing protocol used in the Internet?

  1. OSPF implements Bellman-Ford algorithm to find shortest paths.
  2. OSPF uses Dijkstra’s shortest path algorithm to implement least-cost path routing.
  3. OSPF is used as an inter-domain routing protocol.
  4. OSPF implements hierarchical routing.

  1. Mutual exclusion is satisfied
  2. Deadlock is possible
  3. Mutual exclusion is not satisfied
  4. Both (a) and (b)

Consider a disk uses linked allocation method. Block size in disk is 512 bytes and block pointer size is 16 bytes. A file of 2000 bytes stored in this disk. The number of blocks required to store this file is ________.

  1. 5

The value of following integral is (upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 0.11 [0.11 - 0.12]

  2. (i) and (ii) only
  3. (ii) and (iii) only

  2. Header checksum
  3. HLEN

Table ‘Max’ shows maximum number of instances of a resource required to a process to complete its execution. Currently, system has 3 instances of each resource are available to allocate.   1. System is in safe state.
  2. These are only two orders of completion of processes are possible.

  3. P1, P3, P2 is one of the safe execution completion order.

  4. P3, P1, P2 is one of the safe execution completion order.

Consider a hypothetical CPU which supports 16 bit instruction, 64 registers and 1 KB memory space. If there exist 12 2-address instruction which uses register reference and 12 1-address memory reference instructions how many 0-address instructions are possible?

  1. 1024
  2. 4096
  3. 2048
  4. 8192

  3. System is inconsistent

  2. AB + BC + AC

  3. AB + BC + A

  4. None of these

  1. 2 + 3 E S 4
  2. 2 3 4 E S
  3. S E 2 3 4
  4. 2 3 E 4 S

The value printed by the following program is ________.

Which of the following are correct for a non-deterministic finite automata (NFA)?

  1. An NFA cannot enter into an infinite loop on reading a string.
  2. An NFA rejects a string only when it reaches non-final state on complete reading of string.
  3. An NFA accepts a given string is decidable.

  4. An NFA M, then L(M) is infinite is decidable.

Which of the following are incorrect for single-source shortest path algorithms?

  1. In Bellman-Ford algorithm, if negative-weight cycle is unreachable from source then algorithm produces correct shortest path.
  2. In Bellman-Ford algorithm, if a negative-weight cycle exists and cycle is reachable from source,then algorithm indicates that no solution exists.
  3. In Dijkstra’s algorithm, if negative-weight cycle is not reachable from source, then algorithm always produce correct shortest path.
  4. In Dijkstra’s algorithm, if graph has negative edges, then algorithm always produce incorrect shortest path.

Which of the following languages are decidable. Note that <M> indicates encoding of the Turing Machine (TM) M

  1. L = {<M>?M is a TM and M has odd number of states}

  2. L = {<M>?M is a TM and ?L(M)?≥ 10}

  3. L = {<M>?M is a TM and there exists a string on which M halts in less than 2023 steps}

  4. L = {<M>?M is a TM which accepts atleast one even numbers}

Consider the machine with a byte addressable main memory of 216 byte, block size of 16 byte and a 2 way set associative mapped cache having 210 lines. Suppose there are two bytes in main memory i.e. first byte [E01F]16 and second byte [E208]16 respectively then the difference of the set value (in decimal) between given two bytes i.e. (SET value of second byte – SET value of 1st byte) is

  1. 21
  2. 31
  3. 40
  4. 51

Consider a relation schema r(A, B, C, D, E, F) with following functional dependencies:
A → BCD, BC → DE, B → D, D → A
Which of the following are correct for relation r?

  1. BF is candidate key of r.

  2. Relation r is in 2NF.

  3. Functional dependency B → C can logically implied from above functional dependencies.
  4. Functional dependency B → E can logically implied from above functional dependencies.

Two dice are rolled. Consider the events A = {sum of two dice equals 3}, B = {sum of two dice equals 7} and C = {at least one of the dice shows 1}. Which of the following are correct?

  3. A and C are not independent

  4. B and C are independent

13, 22, 6, 18, 2, 34, 12, 9, 17
Total number of collisions occurs or above insertions is ________.

  1. 11

Consider an IP packet with header length 20 B total length of IP packet is 1400 byte and value of DF flag, MF flag and fragment flag is 0, 0 and 0 respectively.
Ethernet may carry data upto 512 byte [i.e., MTU = 512]. Find the number of payload bytes in last fragment.

  1. 404

Consider a system uses paging with TLB. It takes 10 μs to search the TLB and 100 μs to access the physical memory. System uses 2 level page table implementation. Assume their is no page faults.
If TLB hit ratio is 0.8, then effective memory access time is ________ μs.

Consider a non-pipelined system in which each instruction takes 50 ns to execute. For improvement, system converted into 6 stage pipeline, with 10 ns delay in each stage, and interstage delay is negligible. A program P with 1000 instructions, out of which 200 instructions are branch instructions. Each branch instruction creates two stalls in pipeline. This program P runs on both implementations, non-pipelined and pipelined. The speedup achieved by pipelined over non-pipelined is ________.
[Upto 2 decimal places]

  1. 3.55 [3.55 - 3.56]

Initially tree is empty. Insert following keys in this tree one-by-one in given order:

How many maximum leaf node split occurred in above process?

Consider a multiple choice exam with 10 questions. Each question has 5 options and only are option is correct. A student attempts all questions. The probability of the student to get 8 or more correct answer just by guessing is ________ × 10–5. (Upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 7.79 [7.79 - 7.80]

Consider the following Hasse diagram of a poset:

access R3, which it never gets because R3 is held by P3. P3 is also in a busy wait loop repeatedly trying to access R1.

  4. None of these

Number of times DMA steals the control of a system Bus form the CPU to complete the file transmission is ________?

  1. 4

Where shall they cross each other the second time?

  1. On AD at a distnace of 30 m from A.
  2. On BC at a distance of 10 m from B.

The value of  is

The rank of Qadir, if all are arranged in descending order of their height and the tallest is given rank 1, is __________.

Given below is a paragraph from which the last sentence has been deleted. From the given options, choose the one that completes the paragraph in the most appropriate way. Federer’s fifth grand slam win prompted a reporter to ask whether he was the best ever. Federer is certainly not lacking in confidence, but he wasn’t about to proclaim himself the best ever. “The best player of this generation, yes”, he said, “But nowhere close to ever. Just look at the records that some guys have. I’m a minnow.” _______________

  1. His win against Agassi, a genius from the previous generation, contradicts that.
  2. Sampras, the king of an earlier generation, was as humble.
  3. He is more than a minnow to his contemporaries.
  4. The difference between ‘the best of this generation’ and ‘the best ever’ is a matter of perception.

Assume, first segment is lost but the second segment arrives at H2. Now, in the acknowledgement that H2 sends to H1 in response of second segment, the acknowledgement number is ________. (Assume H1 got ack = 1024, before sending 1st segment)

  3. Blocking of one user-level thread does not necessarily block the entire process.

Consider G = (V, E) to be a connected, weighted, undirected graph with n vertices and m edges, where all edge weights are distinct.
Let T = (V, ET) be a spanning tree of G.
The bottleneck edge of T is the edge of T having the greatest weight.
A spanning tree T is called a minimum bottleneck spanning tree (MBST) if there is no other
spanning tree T′ of G whose bottleneck edge has a smaller weight.
Consider the following statements:
S1 : Every minimum bottleneck spanning tree of G is a minimum spanning tree of G.
S2 : Every minimum spanning tree of G is a minimum bottleneck spanning tree of G.
Which of the following is correct?

  1. Only S1
  2. Only S2
  3. Both S1 and S2
  4. Neither S1 nor S2

Which of the following statements is/are correct?

  1. The minimum number of nodes possible in the B+ tree is 17.
  2. The maximum number of nodes possible in the B+ tree is 18.
  3. The total number of leaf nodes is 13.
  4. The total number of leaf nodes is 12.

  2. A LR(0) configurating set cannot have both shift as well as reduce items.
  3. If a reduce item is present in a LR(0) configurating set it may have other item.
  4. A LR(0) parser can parse any regular grammar.

Let R1 and R2 be two 4-bit registers that store numbers in 1’s complement form. For the operation
R1 + R2, which one of the following values of R1 and R2 gives an arithmetic overflow?

  1. R1 = 1011 and R2 = 1110
  2. R1 = 1100 and R2 = 1010
  3. R1 = 1111 and R2 = 1000
  4. R1 = 1001 and R2 = 1111

A stack is implemented using a circular doubly linked list such that PUSH and POP operations are performed efficiently. Which one of the following statements can be correct?

  1. Both operations can be performed in Ο(1) time.
  2. The worst case time complexity for both operations will be Ω(n).
  3. Stack can not be implemented with the given data structure.
  4. None of these

A computer system’s page fault rate decreases as the amount of main memory increases. Every time the memory is doubled, the page fault rate becomes one fourth of its previous value. Currently, the system has 16 MB of memory, and the page fault rate is 4%. The main memory access time is 600 ns and overall effective memory access time is 250 μs. If the memory is expanded to 64 MB,
calculate the new EMAT is microseconds ________? (Upto 2 decimal)

  1. 16.18

5, 9, 8, 3, 2, 6, 2, 5, 7, 6, 5, 9, 6, 9

Count the number of squares in the following figure:

 
 
  1. 18

1, 5, 14, 30, 50, 55, 91

  1. 5
  2. 50
  3. 55
  4. 91

A man standing on the bank of a river observes that the angle subtended by a tree on the opposite bank is 60°. When he retries 36 m away from the bank, he find the angle to be 30°, the breadth of the river is ____ m.

  1. 18

In a race of 200 m, A can beat B by 31 m and C by 18 m. In a race of 350 m, C will beat B by

  1. 22.75 m
  2. 25 m
  3. 19.5 m

Astronomer: Most stars are born in groups of thousands, each star in a group forming from the same parent cloud of gas. Each cloud has a unique homogeneous chemical composition. Therefore whenever two stars have the same chemical composition as each other, they must have originated from the same cloud of gas.
Which of the following, if true, would most strengthen the astronomer’s argument?

  1. In some groups of stars, not every star originated from the same parent cloud of gas.
  2. Clouds of gas of similar or identical chemical composition may be remote from each other.
  3. Whenever a star forms, it inherits the chemical composition of its parent cloud of gas.
  4. Many stars in vastly different parts of the universe are quite similar in their chemical compositions.

People tend to estimate the likelihood of an event’s occurrence according to its salience; that is, according to how strongly and how often it comes to their attention. By placement and headlines, newspapers emphasize stories about local crime over stories about crime elsewhere and about many other major events.
It can be concluded on the basis of the statements above that, if they are true, which of the following is most probably also true?

  1. The language used in newspaper headlines about local crime is inflammatory and fails to respect the rights of suspects.
  2. The press is the news medium that focuses people attention most strongly on local crimes.
  3. Readers of local news in newspapers tend to overestimate the amount of crime in their own localities relative to the amount of crime in other places.
  4. None of the events concerning other people that are reported in newspapers is so salient in people’s minds as their own personal experiences.

The value of  is

  1. 2
  2. 7
  3. 8
  4. 33

The difference between the compound interest and the simple interest earned on a sum of money at the end of 4 years is To find out the sum, which of the following information given in the statements P and Q is/are necessary?
P : Amount of simple interest accrued after 4 years.
Q : Rate of interest per annum.

  1. Only P is necessary
  2. Only Q is necessary
  3. Either P or Q is necessary
  4. Neither P nor Q is necessary

A boat takes 19 hours for travelling downstream from point A to point B and coming back to a point C midway between A and B. If the velocity of the stream is 4 kmph and the speed of the boat in still water is 14 kmph, what is the distance between A and B?

  1. 160 km
  2. 180 km
  3. 200 km
  4. 220 km

Given below are 4 pairs of words. In three of the pairs, the words are having a meaning similar to each other whereas in one of the pairs, it is the opposite. Identify the option where the words do not have similar meaning.

  1. CONTRAPTION - SIMPLE
  2. JOCUND - MERRY
  3. INSCRUTABLE - ENIGMATIC
  4. LOUCHE - INDECENT

Consider the non-deterministic finite automation (NFA) shown in the figure:

 
 
Start x is the starting state of the automation. Let the language accepted by the NFA with y as the only accepting state be L1. Similarly the language accepted by the NFA with z as the only accepting state be L2. Which of the following statement about L1 and L2 is true?
  1. L1 = L2
  2. L2 ⊂ L1
  3. L1 ⊂ L2
  4. None of the above

The eigen values of the matrix  are in ratio 1 : 1 : 4. If ‘a’ is a positive real number, then the value of ‘a’ will be ________. 

  1. 6

Consider the following regular expressions over alphabet {a, b}, where the notation (a + b)+ means

 


Let L1 and L2 be the languages defined by r1 and r2, respectively. Which of the following regular expressions define L1 ∩ L2?

A fair coin is tossed to determine from which bag a ball will be drawn.
If the coin shows Heads, a ball is picked from Bag 1, which contains 6 red and 9 blue balls.
If the coin shows Tails, a ball is picked from Bag 2, which contains 5 red and 5 blue balls.
After the draw, the ball obtained is observed to be blue.
Find the probability that the ball was drawn from Bag __________. (Upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 0.54

Which of following are true about TCP?

  1. TCP is a connectionless protocol.
  2. TCP uses sequence numbers to ensure in order delivery.
  3. TCP does not perform flow control.
  4. TCP uses 3-way handshake to establish connection.

Consider the following statements:
S1 : Direct access to a record can be supported efficiently if the record is stored in contiguous memory blocks.
S2 : In contiguous allocation, random access is possible in constant time because the address of any record can be computed directly from its position.
Which of the above statements is correct?

  1. Only S1
  2. Only S2
  3. Both S1 and S2
  4. Neither S1 nor S2

A processor overflow flag is represent as OV(a, b, c) where arguments a is MSB of operand 1, b is MSB of operand 2 and c is the MSB of the result after computing a and b. The OV(a, b, c) of PSW becomes 1 after

  1. a′b′c + a′bc′
  2. a′b′c + abc′
  3. ab′c′ + ab′c
  4. a′b′c + abc

A search algorithm is defined as follows:
• First, it performs a Linear Search on the first k elements of a sorted array of size n.
• If the key is not found in the first k elements, it performs a Binary Search on the remaining (n – k) elements.
Assume that the key is present uniformly at random in the array.
If all operations (comparison, jump, etc.) take unit time, what is the expected number of comparisons
required to search for the key using this algorithm?

What is the time complexity of following function fun( )? Assume that log(x) returns log value in base 2.

 
  1. T(n)
  2. T(n log logn)
  3. T(n logn)
  4. T(n2)

Which of the following statements about the User Datagram Protocol (UDP) is TRUE?

  1. UDP guarantees packet delivery using acknowledgments and retransmissions.
  2. UDP includes a checksum field that covers only the UDP header and data, but not the IP header.
  3. UDP uses a pseudo-header in checksum computation to verify that data has been delivered in order.
  4. UDP ensures connection setup before data transmission to avoid loss.

Consider a reduced 7-bit IEEE floating-point format, with 3 bits for the exponent and 3 bits for the significant (Mantissa). What will be the value which get stored in the system corresponding to (–0.5625)?

  1. 1010001
  2. 0101001
  3. 1010101
  4. 1001000

A balanced search tree of order 6 allows each internal node to have at most 6 children, and every non-root node must have at least  children. The height of the tree is defined as follows: a tree with one level has height 0, a tree with two levels has height 1, and so on.
If the tree has a height of 4, what is the minimum number of distinct keys that can be stored in it?

  1. 161

The TCP sequence number field is 32 bits long. Which of the following statements about sequence number wrap-around is TRUE?

  1. TCP sequence numbers wrap around after every 232 segments, regardless of segment size.
  2. TCP sequence numbers wrap around after transmitting 232 bytes of data, which can cause ambiguity if old data is still in the network.
  3. TCP sequence numbers reset to zero whenever an ACK is lost, causing a wrap-around.
  4. Sequence number wrap-around cannot occur in TCP because the numbers are regenerated at every connection setup.

Consider a preemptive SJF scheduling technique followed by three processes P1, P2, P3. All of these 3 processes arrive at time t = 0 and their total execution time is 10, 30, 20 units respectively. Each process spends first 10% of execution doing I/O, 80% CPU and rest doing I/O operation. What will be the CPU idle % time to execute all processes? (Assume a uniprocessor and all I/O operations can be overlapped)

  1. 10.642
  2. 7.692
  3. 12.469
  4. CPU will not be idle

A program has 40% load/store instructions. The ideal CPI without memory stalls is 2.2. The instruction cache miss rate is 2%, and the miss penalty is 100 cycles. The program achieves a speedup of 3 with a perfect cache. Determine the data cache miss rate _________? (in % )

  1. 6

Which of the following statements correctly describes the operation of CSMA/CA in wireless networks?

  1. CSMA/CA detects collisions using the carrier sense mechanism, similar to Ethernet (CSMA/CD).
  2. CSMA/CA avoids collisions by using acknowledgment frames (ACK) and optional RTS/CTScontrol messages before transmission.
  3. CSMA/CA relies solely on random backoff timers, without using any acknowledgment mechanisms.
  4. CSMA/CA allows simultaneous transmissions by using different frequency channels for each node.

A disk with 200 tracks receives requests at tracks 120, 50, 180, 30, 90, 160, 10 and 70. The initial head position is track 100. Compare the total head movement for the First-Come, First-Served (FCFS) algorithm and the Circular SCAN (C-SCAN) algorithm (assume C-SCAN moves toward higher tracks first and jumps to track 0 after reaching the end).
Which of the following is/are correct?

  1. Average seek time of FCFS = 88.75 tracks
  2. Average seek time of C-SCAN = 38.5 tracks
  3. Average seek time of C-SCAN = 48.5 tracks
  4. Average seek time of FCFS = 78.75 tracks

During an I/O interrupt, the following events are observed:
S1 : Finish execution of the instruction in progress.
S2 : Push the program counter and status registers onto the stack.
S3 : Load the ISR address into the PC.
S4 : Execute the ISR.
S5 : Pop the program counter and status registers to resume the interrupted process.
Choose the correct sequence of execution:

  1. S1 → S2 → S3 → S4 → S5
  2. S2 → S1 → S3 → S4 → S5
  3. S1 → S3 → S2 → S4 → S5
  4. S1 → S2 → S4 → S3 → S5

Consider the following two statements about a directed, simple graph G = (V, E) with distinct, positive edge weights
S1 : If G is a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG), then for any pair of vertices there exists a unique shortest
S2 : Let G’ be the underlying undirected graph obtained by ignoring the direction of edges in G.
The Minimum Spanning Tree (MST) of G’ is unique.
Which of the following is correct?

  1. S1 is true, but S2 is false.
  2. S1 is false, but S2 is true.
  3. Both S1 and S2 are true.
  4. Both S1 and S2 are false.

  2. All non-empty linked lists.

  4. Only linked lists where the head node’s next pointer is not NULL.

A linear-probing hash table of length 10 uses the hash function h(x) = x mod 10. After inserting six integer keys into an initially empty hash table, the array of keys is

 
 
Which of the following choice is insertion sequence resulting in the above hash table? Assume that the length of the hash table does not change during the insertions.
  1. 46, 42, 34, 52, 23, 33
  2. 34, 42, 23, 52, 33, 46
  3. 46, 34, 42, 23, 52, 33
  4. 42, 46, 33, 23, 34, 52

During a TCP session setup, Host A advertizes a window scaling factor of 7, and Host B advertizes a window scaling factor of 5. Later in the session, Host A sends data and advertizes a TCP window value of 20,000 bytes in its TCP header. Host B acknowledges and advertizes a TCP
window value of 40,000 bytes. Assuming no congestion or packet loss, determine the actual maximum amount of unacknowledged data that each host can transmit at a time.

  1. Host A → 1,280,000 bytes; Host B → 1,280,000 bytes
  2. Host A → 2,560,000 bytes; Host B → 1,280,000 bytes
  3. Host A → 1,280,000 bytes; B → 40,000 bytes
  4. Host A → 2,560,000 bytes; B → 40,000 bytes

Consider two processes A and B accessing the shared variables X and Y, protected by two binary semaphores P and Q, both initialized to 1. Wait and Signal denote the usual semaphore operations: Wait decrements the semaphore value (and waits if 0), Signal increments the semaphore value. The pseudocode of the processes is as follows:

 
Which of the following statements is correct?
  1. Mutual exclusion is satisfied, but progress is not guaranteed.
  2. Progress and mutual exclusion are satisfied, but bounded waiting may be violated.
  3. Mutual exclusion not satisfied.
  4. Mutual exclusion, bounded waiting and progression is satisfied.

The number of possible finite automata with two states a0 and a1 (where a0 is the initial state over the alphabet {0, 1}) which accepts empty language is ________.

  1. 320

A directed graph G(V, E) with |V| = 6 and |E| = 9 contains a few negative-weight edges but no negative-weight cycles.
The graph is represented using an adjacency list (V1 → V2, wt). A variant of the Bellman-Ford algorithm is run from a source vertex S = 0.
After 5 full iterations of edge relaxations, the distance array dist[ ] contains final shortest path distances from S to all other nodes.
Suppose the edge list is as follows:
(0 → 1, 4), (0 → 2, 5),
(1 → 2, –3), (2 → 3, 2),
(3 → 1, 1), (1 → 4, 6),
(2 → 5, 4), (5 → 3, –2),
(4 → 5, –1)
Based on this, which of the following statements are necessarily TRUE?

  1. Bellman-Ford will update the distance to at least one vertex in every iteration, including the 5th.
  2. The presence of the cycle (1 → 2 → 3 → 1) with total weight 0 implies that Bellman-Ford may keep updating distances indefinitely.
  3. The final distances will be accurate after at most 5 iterations.
  4. If we add an edge (3 → 0, –10), Bellman-Ford will detect a negative-weight cycle in the 6th iteration.

  3. Not Reflexive, Not Symmetric, Not Transitive

Which of the following is incorrect? (/ is right quotient)

  1. If L1 and L2 are CFL, then L1/L2 is regular.
  2. If L1 and L2 are regular, then L1/L2 is regular.
  3. If L1 and L2 are RE, then L1/L2 is RE.
  4. If L1 is CFL and L2 is regular then L1/L2 is CFL.

Consider the following statement with respect to relational algebra and select the correct option(s) given below:

  1. The intersection ‘∩’ operator can be derived using ‘–’ minus which is a basic binary operator in relational algebra.
  2. The join  operator can be derived by using [× (cross product σ (selection and π (projection)] operator.
  3. The ‘+’ or ‘/’ division operator can be derived by using [× (cross product), σ (selection) and π (projection)] operator.
  4. The ‘+’ or ‘/’ division operator can be derived by using [× (cross product), π (projection) and ‘–’ minus] operator.

Consider the state table of a digital circuit given below:

 
 
The total number of redundant states present is equal to __________.
  1. 3

Given a positive integer n, let G = (V, E) be a graph where V = {0, 1}n, i.e. V is the set of vertices which has one-to-one correspondence with the set of all n bit binary strings and  belongs to V}, u and v differ in exactly one bit position?
Find the size of E if n = 8 ________.

  1. 1024

In a distance vector routing network, router A has a direct link to B initially, A’s routing table shows:

 
 
Now, the link between B and C fails, and no loop prevention (split horizon and poison reverse)
Which of the following best describes what happens next?
  1. A immediately removes C from its table after detecting the failure.
  2. B marks C as unreachable and stops advertising it.
  3. A continues to advertise a path to C (via B), and B re-learns a false.
  4. The network instantly reconverges because of triggered updates.

Which of the following is true about lexical analysis?

  1. It scans the source code and generates a parse tree.
  2. It checks the grammar rules and constructs a parse tree.
  3. It breaks the source code into tokens and generates a token stream.
  4. It analyzes the meaning of the source code and generates an intermediate code.

A message is made up entirely of characters from the set P = {W, X, Y, Z}. The table of probability for each characters given below:

 
 
Which of the following are correct?
  1. If a message of 200 characters over P are encoded using Huffman encoding then the expected length of the encoded message is 340 bits.
  2. If a message of 200 characters over P are encoded using Huffman encoding then the expected length of the encoded message is 392 bits.
  3. W and X having the same number of encoding bits when encoded using Huffman coding.
  4. X and Y having the same number of encoding bits when encoded using Huffman coding.

Which of the below are undecidable?

  1. { | M is a Turing Machine and M accepts ∈}.
  2. {<G> | G is a CFG and G is unambiguous}.
  4. Given a CFG G, find whether L(G) = R, where R is regular set.

Which of the following statements correctly describe a Passive Open in TCP?

  1. It is initiated by the server side.
  2. It sends a SYN segment immediately after opening.
  3. The TCP state becomes LISTEN.
  4. It waits for an incoming SYN request.

Consider a Depth First Search (DFS) traversal of a directed graph. Given the set of edges {E} is partitioned into Tree, Back, Forward, and Cross edges, and where Xs and Xe represent the discovery and finish times, respectively.
Which of the following statements are correct? (Select all that apply)

  1. The condition Us < Vs < Ve < Ue must classify the edge (u, v) as a Tree Edge.
  2. If the graph is a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG), no edge in the set E can satisfy the temporal ordering Vs < Us < Ue < Ve.
  3. An edge (u, v) satisfying Vs < Ve < Us < Ue} is Cross Edge
  4. Both Forward Edges and Cross Edges are non-Tree edges, but only Forward Edges connect a node to one of its descendants in the DFS forest.

Consider the following SQL statements:

 
Which of the following SQL statements are valid queries?
(i) SELECT DEPT, COMMISSION FROM EMP WHERE SALARY > 7000 GROUP BY DEPT
HAVING COMMISSION > 200;
(ii) SELECT EMPNAME, SALARY FROM EMP WHERE COMMISSION = NULL AND DEPT =
‘IT’;
(iii) SELECT * FROM EMP WHERE SALARY BETWEEN 6000 AND 8000 GROUP BY DEPT ORDER
BY EMPID;
(iv)SELECT EMPNAME, DEPT FROM EMP WHERE COMMISSION IS NOT NULL AND SALARY
> 6000;
  1. (ii) and (iii)
  2. (iv) and (iii)
  3. (i), (iii) and (iv)
  4. Only (iv)

Consider the following grammar and semantic rules: A → X Y Z
X.val = f(A.in)
Y.val = g(X.val)
Z.val = h(Y.val)
A.out = k(Z.val) and A → M N

  1. Both productions are S-attributed
  2. Both productions are L-attributed but not S-attributed
  3. First production is L-attributed, second violates the L-attributed rule
  4. First production is S-attributed, second is L-attributed

A mixture P is formed by removing a certain amount of coffee from a coffee jar and replacing the same amount with cocoa powder. The same amount is again removed from mixture P and replaced with same amount of cocoa powder to form a new mixture Q. The average score in class A is 83.
The average score in class B is 76.

The average score of all students in classes A and B is 79.

Consider the following interleaved schedule S involving transaction T1, T2 on data item X and Y.

  2. S is serializable away procedure result equal to serial schedule.
  3. S is not serializable, but may results equal to serial if read, write of X, Y in T1 T2 are commutative.
  4. S is serializable and consistent for all data items X and Y.

Values of X and Y are?
  1. X = 3, Y = 5
  2. X = 4, Y = 6
  3. X = 3, Y = 6
  4. X = 5, Y = 6

where B, C are primary keys in respective relation and A is a foreign key in R referencing C in S
and D is a foreign key in S referencing B in R.
which of the following operations does not violate referential integrity constraints?

  1. Inserting the tuple (NULL, X) in R, where X does not exists in D in S.
  2. Updating the tuple (X, Y) with (Z, Y) in S where X does not exist in A in R.
  3. Deleting the tuple (X, Y) in R, where X exist in C is S but Y does not exist in D in S.
  4. Inserting the tuple (X, Y) in R, where X does not exists in C in S.

  1. {B → E, AC → D, D → E, C → B, A → C}
  2. {A → D, C → B, A → C, B → E, D → E}
  3. {B → E, AB → D, D → E, C → B, A → C}
  4. {A → D, B → E, D → C, C → B, A → C}

  2. Σ+ = R{A1, A2, ..... An – 1} and Σ is minimal.
  3. Σ+ = R{A1, A2, ..... An} and Σ may not minimal.
  4. Σ+ = R{A1, A3, ..... An} and Σ is minimal.

In a relational database, which of the following statements about referential integrity is incorrect?

  2. A foreign key can accept NULL values if the foreign key relationship is optional.

  4. The schema violates referential integrity if EID is not NULL and leadID, RevID is NULL.

In the context of index file structures used in database, consider the following three alternatives for storing data entries in an index.
A1 : Each data entry with key k is an actual data record with search key k.
A2 : Each data entry is a pair (k, rid), where rid is the record id of data record with search key k.
A3 : Each data entry is a pair (k, rid-list), where rid-list is the list of all record id’s with search key k.
Which of the following statements are correct?

  1. A1 act as a specialized fill organization that can substitute a sorted or unsorted file.
  2. Both A2 and A3 decouple the index structure from the underlying file organization used for storing data records.
  3. A3 improves space utilization compared to A2, but requires entities to be of fixed length.
  4. A3 while saving space, reduce redundancy but introduce variable length data entries.

How many disk blocks are required to store the second index file, if first level index built-on Bnum.

  1. 4
  2. 3
  3. 5
  4. 2

nodes do not allocate space for block pointers. (Assume root at level 1)

  1. 6

  1. In a wait-die system, if P needs a resource held by Q, then P waits.

  2. In a wait-die system, if Q needs a resource held by P, then Q waits.

  3. In a wound-wait system, if P needs a resource held by Q, then Q yields and waits.

  4. In a wound-wait system, if Q needs a resource held by P, then Q dies.

questions.text:
Which of the following scheduling strategies is used by short term schedular?

  1. Round Robin
  2. FCFS
  3. Shortest Job First
  4. All of the above

Which of the following scheduling algorithms may cause starvation?
S1 : Multilevel queue scheduling
S2 : Highest response ratio next
S3 : Shortest remaining time first
S4 : Pre-emptive algorithm

  1. S1 and S2

  2. S1 and S3

  3. S1, S3 and S4

  4. S1, S2, S3 and S4

Which of the following statements is/are correct?
S1 : Context switching time in FCFS scheduling algorithm have less than equal to Round Robin.
S2 : Average waiting time SJF scheduling algorithm have less compare to Round Robin scheduling.

  1. Only S1

  2. Only S2

  3. Both S1 and S2

  4. None of these

Which of the following statements is/are correct?
S1 : Processes can run in parallel on different processors in multiprocessor system, but not Kernel thread of a process.
S2 : Many to one is the most efficient model of multi-threading because it allows several userlevel threads to be assigned to different processors in multiprocessor computer system.

  1. Only S1

  2. Only S2

  3. Both S1 and S2

  4. Neither S1 nor S2

Which of the following statements is/are correct?

  1. User level thread require memory management where Kernel threads do not.
  2. Kernel level thread contain separate TCB for each thread with in a process, blocking one thread is independent to other thread.
  3. User level thread will have slower than Kernel level thread.

  4. If a Kernel level thread is blocked for operation, then Kernel of operating system will perform content switching to run another Kernel thread which is not blocked.

Which of the following disk scheduling algorithm reduce the response time?

  1. FCFS
  2. SCAN
  3. C-SCAN
  4. SSTF

Which of the following statements with respect to interprocess communication.
S1 : Ensure that processes do not write to same memory location concurrently in shared memory.
S2 : Shared memory follows a faster communication strategy compared to the message passing technique.
S3 : Message passing technique require Kernel support.
Which of the statements are true?

  1. Only S1 and S3

  2. Only S2 and S3

  3. Only S1 and S2

  4. All of the above

Consider the following table given below (all times in ms):

Operating system uses pre-emptive shortest remaining time first algorithm. What is the throughput of the system (assume tries are broken on trans of lowest process Id). (Upto to two decimal places)

  1. 0.30

Match List-I with List-II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

Which of the following is true with respect to schedular?

  1. Mid term schedular increase degree of multiprogramming.
  2. Short term schedular control degree of multiprogramming.
  3. Short term scheduler uses CPU scheduling algorithm.

  4. Long term schedular should select good combination of bound and CPU bound process.

The available main memory for loading processes is of size 128 MB. Which is divided into fixed 8 partition. If the processes of size 12 MB and 10 MB are loaded into memory. The percentage of total internal fragmentation, for these processes is ________ %. (Upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 31.25

Jobs A, B, C, D and E with running time of 13, 10, 5, 9 and 1 respectively arrive at computer in the time order 0, 5, 7, 10, 12. If the priority of these jobs in the order of C, B, E, A and D and the policy used for scheduling is that a higher priority job always succeeds in pre-empting.  (Do not count the context switches at time 0 and end at the end)
Which of the following are correct?

  1. The average waiting time of all the process is 9.6.
  2. The average waiting time of all the process is 8.2.
  3. The number of context switches is 6.
  4. The number of context switches is 8.

Consider the statements regarding disk scheduling algorithm:

Which of the statements is false?

  1. SSTF disk scheduling is suffer from starvation.
  2. The SSTF disk scheduling algorithm increases throughput compared to FCFS.
  3. SCAN disk scheduling algorithm is also known as Elevator algorithm.
  4. SCAN disk scheduling algorithm is suffer from starvation.

A bit map can be used to keep track of which blocks are free in a file system’s partition on disk.
Assuming 1 KB block size and disk size of 64 GB, number of disks blocks for bit map ________ in kilo?

  1. 8

Which of the following statements are false?

  1. In indexed file allocation, for each file separate block is used as an index to store block pointers.
  2. Contiguous allocation supports only random access to disk block.
  3. Larger disk block result in greater internal fragmentation.
  4. Indexed file allocation is suffer form external fragmentation.

Consider a disk system where 10 GB disk rotates at 10000 rpm. The data is transferred at a rate of 107 Bps. The average seek time to 16 ms. Where the block size is 64 KB. The average service time required to retrieve a single disk block from a random location on the disk is ________ ms.
(Upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 25.56

The preemptive priority scheduling algorithm is used. The waiting time for processes P0, P1 and P3 is respectively.

  1. (22, 18, 3)
  2. (21, 15, 0)
  3. (22, 18, 0)
  4. (22, 15, 3)

A unix node has 10 disk addresses for data blocks as well as addresses of single, double and triple indirect blocks. If each of these indirect blocks hold 256 disk addresses. The maximum possible file size is using triple indirect ________ GB. (Assume each disk block is of 1 KB size)

  1. 16

  1. Mutual exclusion and progression
  2. Mutual exclusion and bounded wait
  3. Progress
  4. None of these

  3. (i) and (v) only
  4. (iii) and (iv) only

Which of the following statements is/are correct?
S1 : Dirty bit is used to indicate an illegal access of page.
S2 : Essential content in page table entry is frame number.
S3 : System calls are usually invoked by using a software interrupt.

  1. S1 and S2 only

  2. S2 and S3 only

  3. S1 and S3 only

  4. S1, S2 and S3

Where N is length of queue and ‘q’ and ‘f ’ are counting semaphore where as ‘r’ is binary semaphore.
initially q = N, f = 0 and r = 1

Consider the following is correct?
S1 : The purpose of semaphore r is to be provided mutual exclusion for queue operation.
S2 : The purpose of semaphore ‘q’ is to ensure that deadlock not occur.
S3 : The purpose of semaphore ‘f ’ is to ensure that dequeue is not executed on an empty queue.

  1. Only S1 and S2

  2. Only S2 and S3

  3. Only S1

  4. Only S1 and S3

A situation where processes access and manipulate same data concurrently and the outcome of the execution depends on the particular order in which the access takes place is called.

  1. Mutual exclusion
  2. Convey effect
  3. Process synchronization
  4. Race condition

Consider the following snapshot of a system with five processes (P1, P2, P3, P4 and P5) and four resources (R1, R2, R3, R4).

Which of the following is correct with respect to system snapshot ?

  1. System is in a deadlocked state.
  2. System is in unsafe state.
  3. There are some invalid requests.
  4. System is in safe state.

Consider 6 memory partition each of size 280 KB, 450 KB, 700 KB, 350 KB, 400 KB. 650 KB where KB refers to kilobyte. These partition need to be allocated to four processes of size 250 KB, 460 KB, 25 KB, 700 KB.
Consider the following statements with respect to the above scenario.
S1 : If first fit policy is used, no process will remain unallocated.
S2 : If best fit policy is used, no process will remain unallocated.
Which of the above statement is correct?

  1. Only S1

  2. Only S2

  3. Both S1 and S2

  4. Neither S1 and S2

Consider the following track request in the disk queue:
36, 45, 96, 13, 26, 132, 87, 63, 182
The C-SCAN scheduling algorithm is used and R/W head is positioned at location 50. If tracks are numbered from 0 to 199. Head is moving toward lower track on its service pass the time to move from one track to next track is 3 ns. The total seek time required for servicing these request is ________ μs.

(Assume moving from one end to another end take 15 ns). (Upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 0.57

Consider a paged virtual memory system with 32 bit virtual addresses and 1 KB page size. Each page table entry required 32 bits. It is desired to limit the page table size to one page. Assume multilevel paging is used to implemented the above requirement then how many levels are required?

  1. 5
  2. 4
  3. 2
  4. 3

Which of the following statements is/are correct?
S1 : LRU page replacement suffers from Belady’s Anomaly.
S2 : Page that are shared between two or more processes can never be swapped out to the disk.
S3 : Loading the pages in memory before letting process run is called pre paging.

  1. S1 and S3 only

  2. Only S3

  3. S2 and S3 only

  4. Only S2

A computer system implements a 40 bit virtual address. Page size of 16 KB and size of physical memory is 30 bits. The approximate size of page table in the system is ________ MB.

  1. 128 MB
  2. 64 MB
  3. 48 MB
  4. 384 MB

Consider a demand paged memory system, page table is held in registers. It takes 600 nsec to service a page fault if empty page is available or replaced page is not modified and 750 nsec if the replaced page is modified, main memory access time is 120 nsec. If the page to be replaced is modified 70% of time and page fault rate is 15% then average access time is ________. (Upto 1 decimal place)

  1. 207.7

Consider the following resource allocation graph:

Which of the above is true above given resource allocation graph?

  1. Deadlock occur in both (i) and (ii)
  2. Deadlock occur in (i) but not in (ii)
  3. Deadlock occur in (ii) but not in (i)
  4. None of the above

Consider the two process P0 and P1 using binary semaphore R, S, T initial value of R = 1, S = 0, T = 0.

What will be the output of program when process P0 and P1 concurrently executing?

  1. 1 4 1 3 2 2
  2. 1 4 2 1 3 2
  3. 1 4 1 2 3 2
  4. Both (b) and (c)

3, 2, 1, 5, 6, 3, 2, 7, 1, 3, 6, 7, 3, 2, 6
Assume there are 4 frames are available. represents number of page faults using FIFO, y represents page faults using LRU and z represents page fault using optimal technique. Which of the following is correct?

  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

A CPU generates 36 bit virtual address. The page size is 4 KB. The processor has a translation look aside buffer (TLB) which can hold a total 128 page table entries and 4-way associative. What is the maximum size of TLB tag (in bits)

  1. 24
  2. 36
  3. 19
  4. 12

In order to change from privileged to non-privileged

  1. a hardware interrupt is needed.
  2. a software interrupt is needed.
  3. a privileged instruction is needed.
  4. non-privileged instruction is need.

Consider the following statements:
S1 : The essential content in page table entry is virtual page number.
S2 : Segmentation is suffer from external fragmentation.
S3 : Paging suffer from internal fragmentation.
Which of the above statement is correct?

  1. S1 and S3 only

  2. S1 and S2 only

  3. S2 and S3 only

  4. S4 only

In a demand paging system. The degree of multi-programming is fixed at 4. Measurement were make to determine the utilization of CPU and the paging disk. Result obtained are listed in Group-I, match Group-I and Group-II regarding what describe the measurement best.

  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

Consider a system with physical address of 46 bit. Virtual address of 64 GB, page size is 16 KB. If the last level page table will fit into one page, number of page table level requirements is ________.

  1. 2

Consider two processes P1 and P2, each needed 3 resources. The minimum number of resources needed to ensure deadlock free execution ________.

  1. 5

Which of the following is not true with respect to deadlock prevention and deadlock avoidance schemes?

  1. In deadlock prevention, the request for resources is always granted if resulting state is safe.
  2. In deadlock avoidance, the request for resources is always granted, if the resulting state is safe.
  3. Deadlock avoidance requires knowledge of resource requirements a priori.
  4. Deadlock prevention is more restrictive than deadlock avoidance.

Consider a unix node which maintains 6 direct blocks, 2 single indirect, 1 double indirect and 1 triple indirect DBA. Disk block size is 8 KB and disk block address is 64 bits. Which of following is maximum file size.

  1. 4 TB
  2. 8 TB
  3. 256 GB
  4. 512 GB

Consider five memory partitions of size 150 KB, 500 KB, 180 KB, 450 KB and 600 KB in same order. If sequence of request for block size 212 KB, 430 KB, 112 KB, 530 KB and 280 KB in same order and partitioning can be done in block, then which of the following algorithm satisfy all the block request.

  1. Best fit
  2. First fit
  3. Both next and best fit
  4. None of the above

Consider a paging hardware with a TLB. Assume that the entire page table and all the pages are in the physical memory. If the effective memory access time is 244 msec with TLB hit ratio 0.8 and search time of TLB is 16 msec. The main memory access time is

  1. 170 msec
  2. 190 msec
  3. 210 msec
  4. 244 msec

Which of the following statement are correct?

  1. Contiguous allocation is suffer from external fragmentation.
  2. Linked allocation is suffer from external fragmentation.
  3. Linked allocation only support sequential access of file.
  4. Contiguous allocation supports both sequential and random access of file.

Which of the following disk scheduling algorithm suffers from starvation?

  1. FCFS
  2. SSTF
  3. C-SCAN
  4. None of these

Consider a disk has 200 cylinder, number from 0 to 199. Currently the disk arm is at 50 and moving towards smaller cylinder. There is disk access request for cylinder are 95, 180, 34, 119, 11, 120, 62, 64. What will be the absolute difference traversed by R/W head when CSCAN and CLOOK is used?

  1. 60

Consider the following page reference string:
1, 2, 3, 4, 1, 2, 5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
If program contains 4 page frame then what is difference between page fault obtained using FIFO and optimal page replacement algorithms.

  1. 4

Which of the following is correct?

  1. Demand paging brings a page into the memory only then it is needed.
  2. Demand paging requires more main memory than normal paging.
  3. Demand paging can bring entire process into memory at load time (for very small processes).
  4. In demand paging, a given instruction can lead to page fault.

questions.text:
Which of the following is not directly related to the Process Management (PM) function of an operating system?

  1. Choosing which process run on the CPU next.
  2. Helping process to communicate with each other.
  3. Suspending and resuming process during execution.
  4. Giving memory space to process when they are created.

A system uses Round-Robin scheduling with a time quantum Q, context switch overhead S, and average process burst time before I/O block is T. Which of the following always ensures maximum CPU efficiency? (All process are identical)

  1. Time quantum is less, and context switching time is high
  2. Time quantum is less, and context switching time is also less
  3. Time quantum is large, and context switching time is also large
  4. Time quantum is large, and context switching time is less

In a concurrent system, two semaphore are used:
• Mutex initialized to 1.
• Flag initialized to 0.
• “Shared” is a global variable initialized with 1.
Three threads executes the following code concurrently.

 
Which of the following is/are true about this execution?
  1. If thread A runs before thread C, thread B may block forever.
  2. If thread A runs first, thread B is guaranteed to enter its critical section.
  3. Thread B may enter the critical section even if thread A does not execute.
  4. The flag semaphore act as a signal mechanism dependent on shared’s value.

Which of the following is/are correct?

  1. Two or more processes can concurrently execute the same program.
  2. A process and its child process share the code/program at physical memory because it is static.
  3. A process in user mode cannot execute priviledged instructions.
  4. Threads of a process share the code/program at physical memory because it is static.

Consider the processes with arrival time (in ms) and CPU burst time (in ms) in following table:

 
CPU schedular uses Round-Robin scheduling with time quantum of 3 ms. Which of the following is/are correct for schedule of above processes?
  1. Average turn around time is 15.5 ms.
  2. P3 terminate before P4.
  3. P2 terminate before P3.
  4. P2 first time schedule for CPU at 6 ms.

Which of the following statements is/are correct?
A. Mutual exclusion and no deadlock imply progress.
B. A thread can read/write to another threads if no memory protection used in same process.
C. A context switch is triggered by an interrupt and independent of process dispatching.
D. Multi-level feedback queue may suffer from starvation.

  1. A, B and D
  2. A and B
  3. B and D
  4. A, C and D

Consider a process P invokes the exec( ) system call on UNIX system. Which of following informations of Process Control Block (PCB) of P will change after successful invoke of exec( )?

  1. Process identifier (PID)
  2. Value of program counter stored within user space context on Kernel stack
  3. PID of parent process
  4. Page table entries

Consider the following process states in an operating system. New, Ready, Running, Blocked, Terminated.
Consider the following statements:
1. A process in the running state may voluntarily give up the CPU when time slice expires and transition to ready state.
2. A blocked process can transition to ready state once the resource becomes available.
3. Process move from running state to blocked state if it requests an I/O operation.
4. A process can not move from blocked state to running state without transitioning through the ready state.
Which of the following is not false?

  1. 1, 2 and 4
  2. 2 and 3
  3. 1 and 2
  4. All of the statements

Three concurrent process P1, P2 and P3 execute the following operations without any synchronization (i.e. race condition possible).

 
 
 
Each process executes exactly once, but their operations can be interleaved in any arbitrary order.
Let X and Y be the different values of a and b respectively, after all processes finish.
[Initially a = 0, b = 1]
Which of the following is true?
  1. X = 1, Y = 7
  2. X = 3, Y = 8
  3. X = 2, Y = 9
  4. X = 3, Y = 9

Consider a process has following segment table:

 
 
Logical address for above system represented as . Which of the following logical address for above process is invalid and lead to an error?
  1. <0, 301>
  2. <1, 89>
  3. <2, 845>
  4. <4, 149>

Consider following snapshot of a system with P0, P1, P2 and P3 processes and R0, R1 and R2 resources types. In following table, ‘Allocation’ column shows number of resource types allocated to processes, and ‘Max’ column shows maximum requirement of a resource type by a process.

 
 
System has total 4, 7 and 7 instances of resource types R0, R1 and R2 respectively. From the perspective of deadlock avoidance, which of the following is/are true for above snapshot/instance?
  1. Above snapshot of system is in safe state.
  2. Only one order of processes possible to complete the execution of all processes.
  3. At this snapshot, P1 requests for (R0, R1, R2) = (0, 0, 1) instances and system allocate requested resources to P1. Now, system still in safe state.
  4. At this snapshot, P0 requests for (R0, R1, R2) = (0, 0, 1) instances and system allocate requested resources to P0. Now, system still in safe state.

Consider a system uses TLB, two-level page table, and stores page table in memory. TLB and memory access time are 20 nanoseconds (ns) and 100 ns respectively. TLB have a cache hit ratio of 95%. What is effective access time of memory in nanoseconds?

  1. 130

Which of the following is/are correct?

  1. Aging method is used to remove starvation problem in priority based scheduling.
  2. In terms of response time, Round-Robin scheduling is better than FCFS scheduling.
  3. Multilevel feedback queue schedulings are preemptive type scheduling methods.
  4. Which process will move next from ready state to running state is decided by CPU scheduler.

Which of the following statements are not true with respect to deadlocks?

  1. Circular wait is a necessary condition for the formation of deadlock.
  2. In a system where each resource has more than one instance, a cycle in the wait for graph indicates the presence of a deadlock.
  3. If the current allocation of resources to processes leads the system to unsafe state, then deadlock will necessarily occur.
  4. In the resource allocation graph of a system, if every edge is an assignment edge, then the system is not in deadlock state.

Consider the following code with two threads, Producer and Consumer, that can run parallel.
Further, S and Q are binary semaphore equipped with the standards P (Wait) and V (Signal) operations.
semaphore S = 1, Q = 0; and integer x;

 
Which of the following is TRUE about the program above?
  1. The process can deadlock
  2. One of the threads can starve
  3. Some of the items produced by the producer may be lost
  4. Values generated and stored in ‘x’ by the producer will always be consumed before the producer can generate a new value

Consider a system allocate fixed four frames to a process P. Process P references following pages in given sequence:
1, 5, 3, 8, 3, 6, 5, 1, 7, 8, 3, 5, 1, 3, 5
Let n and m are number of page faults occurs for First-In-First-Out (FIFO) and Least-Recently-
Used (LRU) page replacement policies respectively used by system on execution of P as shown above. The value of n + m is ________. (Initially frames are empty)

  1. 20

Consider the following statements:
1. Loop instructions cannot be interrupted till they complete.
2. Nearest cylinder next disk scheduling strategy gives the best throughput in comparison to first come first serve scheduling strategy.
3. Using large file block size in a fixed block size file system leads to poor disk throughput.
Which of the above statements are false?

  1. Only 1
  2. Only 1, 2 and 3
  3. Only 1 and 3
  4. Only 2

questions.text:
Which of the following suffer from starvation

  1. Longest job first

P2 : Deadlock
P3 : Inconsistent data
P4 : Priority inversion

  3. P1 and P2 only

  4. All the given problem

Consider the following statements:
S1 : Each thread can be scheduled separately.
S2 : Switching between threads is faster.
S3 : Thread frame same process can be run simultaneously on different processors.
S4 : Blocking threads don’t stop the entire process.
Which of the above statement is an advantage of Kernel level threads over user level.

  1. S3 and S4 only

  2. S1 and S3 only

  3. S1, S2 and S4 only

  4. S1, S3 and S4 only

If the time quantum for RR 4 ns, find the difference between average TAT of SJF and RR (upto 2 decimal) ________.

  1. 5.25

Dispatch latency is defined as

  1. The speed of dispatching a process from running to the ready state.
  2. The time of dispatching a process from running to ready state and keeping the CPU idle.
  3. The time to stop one process and start running another one.
  4. None of these

Consider the four processes and their arrival time and burst time.

  1. 5

Which of the following is true?

  1. Long term scheduler create a new process and loads into memory.
  2. Short term scheduler control the degree of multiprogramming.
  3. Both (a) and (b)
  4. None of these

Which of the following are correct?

  1. A solution to the Dining Philosopher problem which avoids deadlock is to ensure that one particular philosopher pick up the left fork before the right fork and that all other philosopher pick up the right fork before left fork.
  2. If each resource type has exactly one instance and if resources allocation graph contain a cycle then the system may or may not be in deadlock.
  3. Race condition occurs when the result of a computation depends on the order of the process executed.
  4. For a system to be in deadlock. Only mutual exclusion, hold and wait, no-preemption condition must be satisfied.

Which of the following statements are true?

  1. Improper use of semaphore can some times lead to deadlock.
  2. Producer cannot produce the item into buffer when the buffer is full.
  3. Multiple writers can write the data base at the same time.
  4. Spin lock is also one type of deadlock.

Which of the following should be allowed only in Kernel mode?

  1. Changing mapping from virtual to physical address.
  2. Disabling all the interrupts.
  3. Reading time of the clock.
  4. Mask and unmask interrupts.

Three process P1, P2 and P3 arrive at time zero. Their total execution time is 10 ms, 20 ms and 30 ms respectively. They spent first 20% of their execution time in doing , next 70% in CPU processing and the last 10% again doing . For what percentage of time was the CPU free? Using SRTF algorithm. (upto 1 decimal places)

  1. 10.6

S2 : Deadlock avoidance requires the system to know maximum resource requirements in advance.

  4. S3 and S4 only
