Operating Systems.display_name: Topicwise Test-13 Part Syllabus GATE 2026 CS Operating System-1

questions.text:
In a system, there are n resource, R1, R2, ..... Rn, each protected by a binary semaphore S1, S2, ..... Sn respectively.
There are large number of processes and each process can request one or more resource at a time.
Each process must request resources in the order: R1 → R2 → R3 ..... Rn
A process will request resource using P(Si) for each resource and then release with V(Si).
Which of the following statements is correct for this system?

  1. Deadlock can still occur because mutual exclusion and hold-wait condition remain.
  2. Deadlock is possible due to violation of the no-preemption rule.
  3. Deadlock is still possible if multiple process requests all n resources simultaneously.
  4. Deadlock is prevented because the circular wait condition is avoided.

A system uses segmentation with paging. The page size is 4 KB and each page table entry (PTE) is 4 B. A process has 5 segments, each accessing 300 unique pages. For each segment, a page table is stored in one page. The segment table is also stored in one page.
No pages is swapped out; all are in main memory. Let X be the number of pages used for the segment and page tables and Y be the number of data pages access. What is X + Y?

  1. 1506
  2. 1505
  3. 1501
  4. 1507

A process generates the following page reference string 7, 0, 1, 2, 0, 3, 0, 4, 2, 3, 0, 3
Assume the system used 3 frames and all frames are initially empty. The page replacement
algorithms considered are Optimal (OPT), Least Recently Used (LRU) and First-in_First-out (FIFO).
Which of the following statements are incorrect?

  1. LRU and optimal replacement algorithm result in the same number of page faults.
  2. FIFO result in less page faults than LRU.
  3. Increasing the number of frames from 3 to 4 leads Belady’s anomaly in FIFO.
  4. All of these

Consider a scenario, having fixed partition allocation scheme where each partition is of size 100 kB, 500 kB, 200 kB, 300 kB and 600 kB. In these partitions, the processes that are needed to be placed are 212 kB, 417 kB, 112 kB and 426 kB (in order). How many partitions will remain
unallocatted after placing the processes in each of first fit, best fit and worst fit algorithm respectively. Also, which policy(s) will be successful in placing all these processes.

  1. 4, 1, 2 ; Best fit and First fit
  2. 2, 1, 2 ; Best fit
  3. 4, 2, 3 ; Best fit
  4. 3, 2, 3 ; Best fit and First fit

A 32 bit machine uses a virtual memory system using single level paging.
The virtual address space is 4 GB and the physical memory size is 1 GB. Each physical page (frame) is of size 4 KB. Each page table entry contains the physical frame number, along with 3 control bits and 1 unused bit.
Calculate the size (in MB) of the page table required for a single process access. (Upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 2.75

Which of the following tasks is/are the responsibility of the Memory Management Unit (MMU):
T1 : Translating a virtual address to a physical address using both the outer and inner page tables.
T2 : Allocating memory for the inner page table when a new page is accessed for the first time.
T3 : Raising a page fault of a required virtual page is not present in the inner page table.
T4 : Updating the outer page table when a new page table is allocated for a new memory segment.

  1. T1 only
  2. T1, T3 and T4
  3. T1 and T3
  4. T1, T2 and T3

In a system with n process P1, P2, ....., Pn, each process Pi requests upto i resources. The system has a total of R resources. (All resources are identical)
Which of the following statement is true regarding the system?

  2.  
  3.  
  4.

Consider a 2-level paging hardware with TLB. Assume that the entire page table and all the pages are in the physical memory. It takes 50 μs to search the TLB and 40 milliseconds to access the physical memory. If the TLB hit ratio is 0.6 and there are no page faults, the effective memory access time (in milliseconds) is ________.

  1. 84.06
  2. 87.06
  3. 72.05
  4. 92.08

Which of the following is correct?

  1. In demand paging, a given instruction can lead to page faults.
  2. Demand paging brings a page into the memory only when it is needed.
  3. Demand paging requires more main memory than normal paging.
  4. Demand paging may bring entire process into memory at load time (for very smaller processes).

Consider a system with physical address of 46 bit, virtual address of 64 GB, page size is 16 KB, if the last level page table will fit into one page, number of page table level required is ________.

  1. 1
  2. 2
  3. 3
  4. 4

  1. System is in unsafe state
  2. System is in deadlock
  3. System is in safe state
  4. None of the above

Consider five memory partitions of size 100 KB, 500 KB, 200 KB, 450 KB and 600 KB in same order. If sequence of requests for blocks of size 212 KB, 417 KB, 112 KB, 426 KB and 280 KB in same order come and partitioning can be done in block, then which of the following algorithm satisfy all the block requests?

  1. Best fit algorithm
  2. Neither first Nor best fit
  3. Both next fit and best fit results in same
  4. None of the above

Which of the following statements is/are true?

  1. In dynamic partition (variable partition) external fragmentation is the problem and solution is compaction.
  2. In fixed partitions degree of multiprogramming is restricted by number of partitions in the memory.
  3. Paging is memory management scheme that supports user view of memory.
  4. A process is thrashing if it is spending more time paging than execution.

Consider a unix inode which maintains 5 direct disk blocks, 1 single indirect, 1 double indirect and 1 triple indirect DBA. Disk block size is 4 KB and disk block address is 32 bits. Which of the following is maximum possible file size using triple indirect in the TB ________.

  1. 4

A disk has 200 cylinders, numbered from 0 to 199. The current head position is at cylinder 85 and the previous request was at 100, so the direction of head movement is towards lower cylinder number. The queue of pending disk requests (in order of arrival) is
[10, 123, 34, 62, 178, 85, 90, 150, 38]
Each cylinder movement takes 1 msec and every request serviced takes an additional 3 msec.
Which is the total time taken by shortest seek time first, look and C-SCAN.

  1. <285, 280, 417>
  2. <280, 270, 420>
  3. <285, 270, 417>
  4. <288, 280, 420>

Consider a system with the below resource allocation graph:

 
Consider the following statements:
S1 : Given system is in deadlock.
S2 : One more instance of R3 required to make system deadlock free.
S3 : Their are two unique safe sequence exist for given system.
S4 : Mutual exclusion and hold-wait condition violated, deadlock here.
Number of the correct statement(s)?
  1. 1

A surveillance system stores video recordings of unknown length, written sequentially. File grow over time and random access is rarely needed. Metadata overhead should be minimum.
Which file allocation method is most suitable?

  1. Contiguous allocation, due to minimal metadata and optimal access time.
  2. Linked allocation, as it allows dynamic growth with low overhead.
  3. Indexed allocation, for scalability and block level direct access.
  4. Contiguous allocation, since fragmentation is avoided and access is predictable.

questions.text:
UDP sockets are best suited for

  1. Large file transfers
  2. Real time voice or video streaming
  3. Banking transaction
  4. Encrypted communication

What system call is used to establish a TCP connection on the client side?

  1. Listen( )
  2. Bind( )
  3. Accept( )
  4. Connect( )

UDP socket can use connect( ) system call to

  1. set a default peer address for send/receive
  2. establish connection
  3. make it reliable
  4. None of these

In persistent http connection after accessing objects from server by client, when does connection closes?

  1. A separate http request has to send to close the connection.
  2. A timer is initiated at TCP level and once it expires, it closes connection.
  3. Connection will never close.
  4. None of these

Initial sender window size in TCP is 1 MSS then the sender window size after 3 RTTS in slow start algorithm is ________ MSS.

  1. 8

In which scenario does a client send a request to port 80 but the actual http server or the machine listens on port 7000.

  1. When the http server is directly bound to port 80.
  2. When a reverse proxy listens on port 80 and forwards requests to port 7000.
  3. When the client mistakenly connects to port 80 instead of port 7000.
  4. When the server redirects all traffic to port 80 regardless of configuration.

In a reverse proxy set up where a client connects to port 80 and the proxy forwards the request to a backend server on port 50000, how many serial TCP connections are typically established? ________.

  1. 2

How can IP address of a computer can be known?

  1. By checking configuration files in |etc| hosts
  2. By using IP config command in command prompt
  3. By using arp command in command prompt
  4. None of these

Storing the IP address of host name at local DNS server will help in

  1. reducing the overall average DNS delay.
  2. applications to load fastly.
  3. routers to process packets and forward fastly
  4. None of these

Once the browser gets the IP address of the concerned host name from DNS then the next step is

  1. http request for first object can be initiated.
  2. can initiate a TCP connection to the http server.
  3. design the distributed DNS servers.
  4. design the centralized DNS servers.

Which of following is true in case of flow control policies of TCP and congestion policies of TCP?

  1. It supports selective acks as per updated RFCS.
  2. It supports elastic applications.
  3. It can guarantee minimum communication rate.
  4. None of these

Which module is responsible for attaching transport layer header and network layer header in TCP/IP model?

  1. Network NIC card
  2. Kernel of operating system
  3. CPU of computer
  4. None of these

Which of following is true in case of sockets of TCP?

  1. When server has accepted the one client connection, then same server cannot accept further connections from different clients.
  2. When server has accepted one client connection, then same server can accept further connections from different clients.
  3. Listen( ) and accept( ) are the system calls at the server side.
  4. Listen( ) and accept( ) are the system calls at the client side.

Which module can analyze network layer header and validate it, when data is transmitted from source to destination?

  1. The mediating router’s Kernel.
  2. The destination station’s Kernel at network layer.
  3. Bridges at the data link layer.
  4. None of these

Which of following is true in case of networking devices?

  1. Firewall is a security device.
  2. Router is a routing device.
  3. Hub is a two port device.
  4. Repeater is a active device.

The total length field given in the IP protocol is 16 bits. If the total length field in IP header is given as 0000 0000 0000 0000 then it indicates.

  1. One byte
  2. No data or zero bytes
  3. Header size
  4. None of these

Which of following is client to server protocol and when the message is transmitted, both are fixed ports?

  1. HTTP
  2. DHCP
  3. SMTP
  4. FTP

Which of following is true in networking?

  1. All the computers connected in same network should have same prefix.
  2. More than one computer of a same network cannot be connected interface of router, in between bridge is required.
  3. MAC address supports hierarchical system.
  4. None of these

Which of following is true if server is connected to two clients at same time using TCP sockets?

  1. Common TCP variables like SYN, ACK are provided to two connections.
  2. Separate TCP variables like SYN, ACK are provided to two connections.
  3. Still Listen( ) system call will be available for further new connections.
  4. None of these

Which type of sockets are used when the application wants to use the functions of IP layer or to develop some tools like ping?

  1. STREAM sockets
  2. D-GRAM sockets
  3. RAW sockets
  4. None of these

Consider that 10 machines need to be connected in a LAN using 8 port ethernet switches. Assume that these switches do not have any separate uplink ports.
The minimum number of switches needed are ________.

  1. 2

Parity scheme is implemented for error detecting in transmitting data. Even parity concept is used for adding parity to the data bits.
Then the hamming distance between the valid codewords is always

  1. odd number
  2. even number
  3. both odd and even numbers possible
  4. None of these

In a communication network, a packet of length L bits takes link L1 with a probability of P1 or link L2 with a probability of P2. Link L1 and L2 have bit error probability of b1 and b2 respectively. The probability that the packet will be received without error via either L1 or L2 is

A UDP server has to be configured to connect to one client only then the API on machine should support.

  1. Bind( ) system call
  2. Listen( ) system call
  3. Connected UDP socket
  4. None of these

Which one of following is/are  client server application?

  1. SFTP
  2. Whatsapp
  3. Ping
  4. HTTP

For a host machine that uses the token bucket algorithm for the congestion control, the token bucket has a capacity of 1 Megabyte and the maximum output rate is the 20 Megabytes per second. Tokens arrive at a rate to sustain output at a rate of 15 Megabytes per second. The token bucket
is currently full and the machine needs to send 12 Megabytes of data.
The minimum time required to transmit the data is ________ seconds.

  1. 2.2

A link of capacity 200 Mbps is carrying traffic from a number of sources. Each source generates an on-off traffic stream, when the source is on, the rate of traffic is 10 Mbps, and when the source is off, the rate of traffic is zero. The duty cycle which is ratio of on time to off time is 1 : 2. When there is no buffer at the link, the minimum number of sources that can be multiplexed on the link. So that link capacity is not wasted and no data loss occurs is S1.
Assuming that all sources are synchronized and that the link is provided with a large buffer, the maximum number of sources that can be multiplexed so that no data loss occurs is S2. The values of S1 and S2 respectively.

  1. 10 and 30
  2. 20 and 60
  3. 5 and 33
  4. 15 and 22

Which of the following functions must be implimented by a network protocol over and above the data link protocol:

  1. End to end connectivity
  2. Reliable flow of data
  3. Routing of data packets
  4. Framing of data packets

On a wireless link, the probability of frame error is 0.4. A stop and wait ARQ protocol is used to transfer data across the link. It is a memory less channel i.e., independents from transmission to transmission. What is the average number of transmission attempts required to transfer 96 packets?

  1. 100
  2. 125
  3. 160
  4. 200

Identify the correct order in which a server process must invoke the function calls sendto( ), recvto( ), socket( ), bind( ) according to UDP socket API.

  1. Bind( ), socket( ), sendto( ), recvto( )
  2. Sendto( ), recvto( ), bind( ), socket( )
  3. Socket( ), bind( ), sendto( ), recvto( ),
  4. None of these

The traffic generated by the device to the device in network is known as

  1. management plane traffic
  2. control plane traffic
  3. data plane traffic
  4. None of these

Consider a simple communication system where multiple nodes are connected by a shared broadcast medium (like ethernet of wireless).
The nodes in the system use the following carrier sense based medium access protocol.
A node that receives a packet to transmit will carrier sense the medium for 5 units of time.
If the node does not detect any other transmission in this duration, it starts transmitting it’s packet in the next time unit.
If the node detects another transmission, it waits until this other transmission finishes and then begins to carrier sense for 5 time units again.
Once they start to transmit nodes does not perform any collision detection and continue transmission even it a collision occurs.
All transmissions last for 20 units of time. Assume that the transmission signal travels at speed of 10 meters per unit time in medium.
Assume that the system has two nodes P and Q located at d distance a meters from each other. P
starts transmitting a packet at time t = 0 and begins to carrier sense the medium.
The maximum distance d (in meters, rounded to closest integer) that allows Q to successfully
avoid a collision between its proposed transmitted and P’s ongoing transmissions is ________.

  1. 50

An upper layer packet is split into 8 frames each of which has 40% chance of arriving damaged.
Also assume that no error control is done at data link layer. How many times the message is sent on an average to get the entire message through?

  1. 24.65
  2. 13.33
  3. 59.54
  4. 20

Computer Networks.display_name: Topicwise Test-17 Part Syllabus GATE 2026 CS Computer Networks-1

questions.text:
The maximum length of the cable (in km) for transmitting data at a rate of 10 Mbps in an ethernet
LAN with frames of size 288 bits and the speed of propagation is 200 m/μsec __________. (Upto one decimal place)

  1. 2.8

MAC address which is internally assigned to computer supports

  1. Flat structure
  2. Hierarchical structure
  3. Prefix and suffix structure
  4. None of these

Buffer is required at receiver side of data link layer. What is its purpose?

  1. To accept out of order data frames and hold it temporarily for sorting.
  2. To discard out of order frames.
  3. To retransmit the data.
  4. None of these

The number of links used in half duplex in point to point link

  1. 1
  2. 2
  3. 3
  4. None of these

Consider the following statements:
S1 : DNS can use either of TCP or UDP, for its query and response messages.
S2 : SMTP is not used for transferring e-mail messages from the recipients’s mail server to the recipients’s personal computer.
S3 : HTTP can use multiple TCP connections between the same client and the server.
S4 : POP protocol is used to download an E-mail from mailbox server to a mail client.
Which of the above statement are correct?

  1. Only S3 and S4
  2. Only S1, S2 and S4
  3. Only S1, S3 and S2
  4. Only S2, S3 and S4

In P-persistent CSMA network there are 6 systems in a slot. The probability of each station sending the data is 0.7 and to avoid collision only 2 stations should transmit the data at a time. What is the probability that channel is collision free? ________ (Upto three decimal places)

  1. 0.069

Consider different activities related to e-mail. Which of the following statements is/are correct?

  1. Sending an e-mail from a mail client to a mail server uses SMTP protocol.
  2. Sending an e-mail from a mail client to a mail server uses POP protocol.
  3. Downloading an e-mail from mailbox server to a mail client uses POP protocol.
  4. Downloading an e-mail from mailbox server to a mail client uses SMTP protocol.

Consider a 40 Kbps satellite link has a propagation delay of 504 ms. The transmitter employs the “go back n ARQ” scheme with n set to 15. Assuming that each frame is 105 bytes long, the maximum data rate possible is ________ (in kbps). (Upto two decimal places)

  1. 12.24

Match the following control commands and their respective port numbers:

 
 
  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

Suppose station A connected to station B with a intermediate router. The number of times data link layer are visited from source to destination _________.

  1. 4

A bit stream 10011101 is transmitted using the standard CRC method. The generator polynomial is x3 +1. Receiver receives the bit stream 10111101100. With respect to the above scenario, which of the following statements is correct?

  1. There was no error in the received data hence receiver accept the data received.
  2. There was error in the received data, but the received bit stream is a multiple of 1001, hence error was not detected.
  3. There was an error in the third bit from the left. Dividing that the generator yields 100.
  4. None of these

Consider a network connecting two systems located 4000 kilometers apart. The bandwidth of the network is 64 Mbps. The propagation speed of the media is 2/3 of the speed of light in vacuum.
It is needed to design selective repeat sliding window protocol for this network. The average packet size is of 8 Kb. The network is to be used to its full capacity.
Assume that processing delays at nodes are negligible. Then, the minimum size in bits of the sequence number field has to be _________.

  1. 10

Consider the following statements:
(a) Hidden terminals can be handled by using either of RTS or CTS control frame.
(b) RTS/CTS exchange helps in reducing collisions and leads to efficient use of channel resources.
(c) 802.11 frame has three address fields.
(d) By the help of 802.11 frame, we can come to known whether encryption is used on not.
Which of the above statement is correct?

  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

Go back N ARQ protocol will fail between two end system on a condition where m is number of sequence bits, when

  1. S.W.S. < 2m
  2. S.W.S. = 2m
  3. S.W.S. = m
  4. None of these

Protocol of networks are applied between

  1. Sender’s data link layer and receiver’s network layer
  2. Sender’s data link layer and receiver’s data link layer
  3. Receiver’s data link layer and receiver’s network layer
  4. Sender’s network layer and sender’s data link layer

The maximum power of the CRC generator polynomial is ‘n’ then the number of padding bits added are

  1. n – 1
  2. n
  3. n + 1
  4. None of these

The number of padding bits added to received codeword in CRC if generator is xn + 1 is

  1. n – 1
  2. n
  3. 0
  4. n + 1

Computer Networks.display_name: Topicwise Test-18 Part Syllabus GATE 2025 CS Computer Networks-2

questions.text:
Which of following is true in Networking Protocols?

  1. In Congestion Avoidance algorithm of TCP, the increase of sender window size is based on RTT.
  2. FTP supports only in band connection.
  3. Root DNS server can contain IP address of complete URL given by client browser.
  4. None of these

Which of following cases wrap around happens in networking?

  1. After 65536 identification numbers for the packets, wrap around happens.

  2. After 28 sequence numbers, wrap around happens for the bytes of segment in TCP.

  3. After 65536 sequence numbers, wrap around happens for bytes of segment in TCP.
  4. None of these

Source S is connected to destination D with the intermediate router

Which of following is true regarding TCP checksum that is calculated?

  1. TCP checksum is calculated at sender side and at router TCP checksum again calculated for verification and accepting segment.
  2. TCP checksum is calculated at sender side and at destination TCP checksum again calculated for verification and accepting segment.
  3. TCP checksum is calculated at sender side after CRC calculation for data at sender side.
  4. None of these

Which of the following parameters used to distinguish packet, frame, byte in a segment?

  1. Sequence number, IP address, port number
  2. Identification number, sequence number, sequence number
  3. Identification number, port address, sequence number
  4. None of these

Which of following is true in case of ICMP protocol?

  1. ICMP error message will act as fault tolerant ack for TCP global ack if it is lost.
  2. TCP global ack will act as fault tolerant ack for ICMP error message that is lost
  3. When ICMP error message is lost, then at upper layer UDP will send ACK for datagrams that are lost.
  4. None of these

Segments are transmitted from client TCP to server TCP. Calculate w values of acknowledgments transmitted by server TCP to client TCP?

  1. 1000

Segments are transmitted from client TCP to server TCP. Calculate d values of acknowledgments transmitted by server TCP to client TCP?

  1. 2000

Which of following is correct with respect to persistence timer in TCP?

  1. Persistence timer is started and probe segment is transmitted, when receiver TCP sends ACK segment with window size zero.
  2. Persistence timer is started whenever receiver TCP sends ACK segment with window size zero and if next ack from receiver is lost , then once again persistence timer is started and probe segment is transmitted.
  3. Persistence timer will not be started whenever receiver TCP sends ACK segment with window size zero and if next ack from receiver is lost, then persistence timer is started and probe segment is transmitted
  4. Persistence timer is started to overcome deadlock.

Which of following is true with TCP header fields of transport layer?

  1. PSH segment can be used for sending interactive data and data need not be buffered at sender TCP.
  2. Window size in TCP header is used for synchronization between sender TCP and receiver TCP.

  3. Initial connection establishment from sender TCP and receiver TCP requires random sequence number from range (0 to 232 – 1).

  4. Initial connection establishment from sender TCP and receiver TCP requires zero as sequence number.

Client is trying to establish a http connection to the server with source port 62000 and destination port 83. The initial SYN segment sent by client is having sequence number 899. Then which segment will be replied by server.

  1. ACK 900
  2. RST segment
  3. Data segment
  4. None of these

Which of following is true in case of transport and network layer protocols?

  1. Maximum segment size as per RFC standard is 216.

  2. Fragmentation is done when network layer is giving data to transport layer.
  3. TCP is connectionless service and UDP is connection oriented service.
  4. Maximum packet size allowed by IP protocol is 65535 bytes.

Tracerroute reports a possible route that is taken by packets moving from some host A to some other host B. Which of following options represent the technique used by tracerroute to identify the hosts

  1. By progressively querying routers about the next router on the path to B using ICMP packets starting with first router.
  2. By requiring each router to append the address to the ICMP packet as it is forwarded to B. The list of all routers enroute to B is returned by B is an ICMP reply packet.
  3. By ensuring that an ICMP reply packet is returned by A by each router enroute to B in the ascending order of their hop distance from A.
  4. By locally computing shortest path from A to B.

Suppose that IP-over-Ethernet network, a machine X wishes to find the MAC address of another machine Y in its subnet. Which of following techniques can be used for this?

  1. X sends ARP request packet to the local gateway’s IP address which then finds the MAC address of Y and sends to X.

  2. X sends ARP request packet to the local gateway’s MAC address which then finds the MAC address of Y and sends to X.

  3. X sends ARP request packet with broadcast MAC address in its local subnet.

  4. X sends ARP request packet with broadcast IP address in its local subnet.

Calculate number of collision domains:

  1. 4

Consider a source computer (S) transmitting a file of size 106 bits to a destination computer (D) over a network of two routers (R1 and R2) and three links (L1, L2 and L3). L1 connects S to R1, L2 connects R1 to R2 and L3 connects R2 to D. Let each link of length 100 km. Assume signals travel over each line at a speed of 108 m/sec. Assume that the link bandwidth on each link is 1 Mbps. Let the file broken down in to 1000 packets each of size 1000 bits. Find the total sum of transmission
and propagation delays in transmitting the file from S to D? ( milliseconds )

  1. 1005

Which of following is true in case of time wait timer of TCP?

  1. To overcome deadlock between client and server process.
  2. To stop new connection during this time.
  3. To stop malicious requests during this time.
  4. None of these

TCP connection is established from client to server. Both sides connection is established and transmitting the data, suddenly server is crashed and rebooted. Which of following situation can be expected from server?

  1. After rebooting, server will send FIN segment to the client.
  2. After rebooting, server will send RST segment to the client.
  3. Before rebooting of server, if client all keep alive timers expire, then client cannot transmit data in same connection.
  4. None of these

  1. 1

  4. None of these

Purpose of DHCP protocol is

  1. assign static private IP address only
  2. assigns dynamic private IP address only
  3. assigns both static and dynamic IP address
  4. None of these

Which of following IP address cannot be assigned to the computer?

  1. 160.14.0.0
  2. 160.14.0.2
  3. 192.168.1.4
  4. 200.10.0.2

Which of following IP addresses can be assigned in single network?

  1. 192.168.0.2, 192.168.1.4
  2. 172.16.0.4, 172.17.0.5
  3. 172.18.0.5, 172.18.0.6
  4. None of these

An organization is granted the block 178.52.0.0/16, the administrator wants to create 510 subnets,
what is the first and last IP address respectively in the last subnet that can be assign to the host?

  1. 178.52.255.120/25, 178.52.254.254/25
  2. 178.52.255.129/16, 178.52.255.129/16
  3. 178.52.255.128/26, 178.52.255.254/25
  4. 178.52.255.129/25, 178.52.255.254/25

Consider the following IP addresses and which of the following IP address may represents last host of any subnet, given subnet mask is 255.255.255.224?
(i) 196.24.63.127
(ii) 196.24.63.94
(iii) 196.24.63.62

  1. (i) and (ii)
  2. (ii) and (iii)
  3. (i) and (iii)
  4. Only (i)

The pattern that is followed by the subnets, if the initial subnet is x and subnet mask is 255.255.255.240

  4. None of these

Match the following functions:

 
  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

Which of the following statements is TRUE about IPv4 protocol?

  1. A best-effort delivery service, best-effort means that IPv4 provides no error control or flow protocol.
  2. TTL field is used to optimize throughput.
  3. IPv4 supports only unicast and broadcast addressing mode.
  4. ARP is used to acquire the IP address of a host whose MAC address is known.

Consider the following scenario:

 
Suppose a TCP message that contains 900 B of data and 20 B of TCP header is passed to IP code at host A for delivery to B. IP header is of 20 B.
Assume that link A-R1 has maximum frame size of 1024 B including a 14-B frame header, link R1 – R2
can support a maximum frame size of 512 B, including an 8 B frame header and link R2-B can
support a maximum frame size 512 B including a 12 B frame header.
The length of the last fragment at each of the three links respectively are:
  1. 920; 440; 440
  2. 960; 460; 440
  3. 960; 460; 460
  4. 940; 460; 460

Let the size of congestion window of a TCP connection be 38 KB when a timeout occurs. The propagation time of the connection is 100 msec and the maximum segment size used is 2 KB. The time taken (in msec) by the TCP connection to get back to 38 KB congestion window is ________.

  1. 3000

Consider a router that interconnects three subnets:
Subnet 1, Subnet 2 and Subnet 3. Suppose all of the interfaces in each of these three subnets are required to have the prefix 223.1.17/24.
[Also suppose that subnet-1 is required to support upto 125 interfaces and subnet-2 and 3 are each required to support upto 60 interfaces].
Which one of the following options represents a feasible set of subnet address / subnet mask pairs?

  1. 223.1.17.0 / 25 and 223.1.17.128 / 26 and 223.1.17.64 / 26
  2. 223.1.17.128 / 25 and 223.1.17.192 / 26 and 223.1.17. 0 / 26
  3. 223.1.17.128 / 25 and 223.1.17.0 / 26 and 223.1.17.64 / 26
  4. 223.1.17.192 / 26 and 223.1.17.0 / 25 and 223.1.17.128 / 25

Which of the following is true?

  1. ICMP error message generated only for the first fragment.
  2. Distance vector is inter domain protocol.
  3. Link state routing uses Bellman Ford algorithm to compute distance.
  4. OSPF is inter domain protocol.

Consider the following socket API functionalities:
S1 : It is used on the server side and causes a bound TCP socket to enter listening state.
S2 : It is used on the server side, and associates a socket with a socket address structure.
S3 : It is used on the client side, and assigns a free local port number to the socket.
S4 : It causes the system to release resources allocated to a socket.
Which of the following is correct?

 
  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

Which of the following statements is true?

  1. The size of TCP receiver window never change throughout the duration of connection.
  2. Suppose host A is sending a large file to host B over a TCP connection. The number of unacknowledged bytes that host A send cannot exceeds the size of advertised receiver buffer.
  3. When a strict routing has been specified by the source but can’t be followed by the intermediate routers, such events will not be reported by ICMP.
  4. Symmetric encryption algorithm is same as public key encryption algorithm.

Consider a network system consisting of three networks connected with two routers. Network- A has MTU of 1500 bytes, Network-B has MTU of 620 bytes, Network-C has MTU of 1500 bytes (MTU includes header size).

 
Station-1 needs to send a segment of1380 bytes. The Total size of the packets received at Network-C is _________ bytes if the header size is 20 B.
  1. 1440

questions.text:
Which of following option can be used to increase the default sequence bits of TCP protocol in transport layer?

  1. Window scaling factor option
  2. NOP option
  3. EOP option
  4. Time stamp option

What can be the possible situation of window size of 16 bits are used as 30 bits (i.e. window size + window scaling factor option) in TCP protocol?

  1. Wrap around condition occurs immediately in transmitting less number of segments as size of segment is large.
  2. Size of default segment cannot be increased.
  3. Deadlock can occur as both sender and receiver are waiting.
  4. None of these

The minimum hamming distance from one valid code word to another valid code word is K.
Then the maximum number of errors that can be detected are?

  1. K
  2. K – 1
  3. 2K
  4. None of these

The initial MSS (maximum segment size) set by receiver TCP will be available in

  1. TCP data segment
  2. TCP syn segment
  3. TCP (syn + ack) segment
  4. None of these

The initial MSS (maximum segment size) set by sender TCP will be available in

  1. TCP data segment
  2. TCP syn segment
  3. TCP fin segment
  4. None of these

  1. Different fields of classless addressing

  3. Prefix notation of classless addressing
  4. None of these

c1 = 201.78.89.33/27
c2 = 201.78.89.49/27

The total number of subnets in above network architecture are ________?

A network administrator is connecting hosts C1 and C2 directly through their ethernet interfaces as shown in figure. Ping attempts between C1 and C2 are unsuccessful. What can be done to provide connectivity between C1 and C2 or ping attempts to be successful?

ॊऩ

  1. C2 IP address should be changed to 192.168.1.193
  2. C1 IP address should be changed to 192.168.1.193
  3. Both C1 and C2 mask changed to 255.255.255.0
  4. Both C1 and C2 mask changed to 255.255.255.192

Router is connected to three subnets. Which of following is true from three subnets?

  1. Company requirement of 130 hosts in any one of three subnet are allowed.
  2. Company requirement of 60 hosts in any one of three subnet are allowed.
  3. The network comes under equal length subnetting.
  4. The network comes under variable length subnetting.

Router is connected to four subnets. Which of following is true from four subnets?

  1. The subnet mask for all four subnets is 255.255.255.192.
  2. Company requirement of 120 hosts in any one of four subnet are allowed.
  3. A system in the subnet 50.15.60.0/26 wants to broadcast in same subnet it uses 255.255.255.255.
  4. The network comes under variable length subnetting.

Router is connected to four subnets. Which of following is true from four subnets?

  1. No of prefix bits in each subnet is 27.
  2. No of hosts in each subnet allowed are 30.
  3. The DBA of all subnets should have last end 4 bits should be 1.
  4. The DBA of all subnets should have last end 5 bits should be 1.

B and C nodes and A is the access node CSMA/CA Protocol is used. Which of following is true?

  1. All node B, A, C share a single shared channel.
  2. Both nodes B and C can send RTS at same time and acquire shared channel of A at same time.
  3. Each node of B, A, C has their own shared channel.
  4. None of these

Which of following are true in case of computers connected with bridges?

  1. Bridge forwards or blocks data based on IP address.
  2. Number of broadcast domains in entire network are 1.
  3. When LAN’s are converted in VLAN’s , then broadcast domains be increased.
  4. Number of broadcast domains in entire network are 3.

Which of following are true in case of computers connected with bridges?

  1. Links connected between bridge and computers are known as access links.
  2. Links connected between the bridges are known as trunk links.
  3. Between similar lans more than one bridge is connected to support fault tolerance.
  4. None of these

All the stations are connected in star topology with passive hub as centric device. Then which of following is true?

  1. When system 1 wants to send data to system 4 with unicast mac address of station 4 Then the data will only go to station 4.
  2. When system 1 wants to send data to system 4 with unicast mac address of station 4 Then the data will go to all stations in network.
  3. When system 1 wants to send data with destination mac address FF : FF : FF : FF : FF : FF Then the data will go to all stations in network.

Which of following are true, in case of computers connected with bridges?

  1. When c1 broadcast data to c2, c3, it will go to c2 and c3 only.
  2. When c1 broadcast data to c2, c3, it will go to ( c2, c3) and (c4, c5, c6) also.
  3. When LAN’s are converted in VLAN’s , then broadcast domains can be increased.
  4. Number f broadcast domains in entire network are 6.

Stop and wait arq protocol is used in data link layer in which frames are transmitted. Frames are transmitted from sender to receiver with sequence number attached. Once frames reached safely, concerned acknowledgments are transmitted from receiver to sender. Find out the error in given diagram?

  1. 2nd line should not be ack1

  2. 3rd line should not be frame 1

  3. 4th line should not be ack1

  4. None of these

c1 = 201.78.89.33/27

Computer c1 connected to R1 wants to broadcast to all the systems connected to R2.
What will the value of last octet of broadcast address?

The given network supports three level hierarchy. Level 1 is net id, level 2 is subnet id’s and level 3 is hosts in each subnet. Given net ID is 201.34.67.0 and given subnet mask is 255.255.255.192. Calculate the total number of hosts in 2 subnets 201.34.67.64 and 201.34.67.128

When station 1 wants to transmits the data to station 3, then the signal will go to how many stations in the below diagram:

A, B, C are three routers. The delays from A to B, B to C, C to A are 3, 4, 5. Routers are not using periodic timers. What would be the final routing table entry for route B from A is ________.

  1. 3

A, B, C are three routers. The delays from A to B, B to C, C to A are 3, 4, 5. Every router is using periodic timer to routes to other routers. How many links are still active once router C is crashed?

  1. 1

The number of broadcast domains in the below diagram are ________.

  1. 2

In the below diagram the sum value of collision domains + broadcast domains is _________.
(LAN is not converted into VLAN)

  1. 5

Router is connected to four subnets. Which of following is true from four subnets?

  1. Number of prefix bits in each subnet is 6.
  2. Company requirement of 60 hosts in any one of four subnets are allowed.
  3. The network comes under equal length subnetting.
  4. The network comes under variable length subnetting.

Router is connected to three subnets. Which of following is true from three subnets?

  1. Total number of broadcast domains in above diagram are 3.
  2. Any system in network 30.15.60.0/25 can broadcast to all systems in subnet with address 30.15.60.255/26.
  3. The network comes under equal length subnetting.
  4. The network comes under variable length subnetting.

Computer Networks.display_name: Topicwise Test-17 Part Syllabus GATE 2025 CS Computer Networks-1

questions.text:
Calculate number of subnets inside the enterprise network?

  1. 3
  2. 6
  3. 7
  4. 8

Host X has IP address 192.168.1.97 and is connected through two routers R1 and R2 to another host Y with IP address 192.168.1.80. Router R1 has IP address 192.168.1.135 and 192.168.1.110. R2 has IP address 192.168.1.67 and 192.168.1.155. The network mask used in network 255.255.255.224. Given information above, how many distinct subnets are guaranteed to already exist in network?

  1. 1
  2. 2
  3. 3
  4. 6

Consider three machines M, N and P with IP addresses 100.10.5.2, 100.10.5.5 and 100.10.5.6 respectively. The subnet mask is set to 255.255.255.252 for all the three machines. Which one of following is true?

  1. M, N and P all belong to same subnet
  2. Only M and N belong to same subnet
  3. Only N and P belong to same subnet
  4. M, N and P belong to different subnets

Calculate number of collision domains and broadcast domains?

  1. 1, 7
  2. 7, 1
  3. 1, 1
  4. 7, 7

In the below diagram source S is connected to destination D via the mediating router R. How many times transport TCP headers are attached and removed?

  1. 2, 2
  2. 1, 1
  3. 3, 3
  4. None of these

Present sender window size in slow start algorithm of TCP is 6400 bytes. Maximum segment size is 200 bytes. What would be the next window size in (mss) if no congestion happens ? _______

  1. 64

Calculate the number of times TCP checksum is calculated from S to D when data is transmitted from S to D?

  1. 2

Which of following is true in case of networking protocols?

  1. Segmentation is done when transport layer is giving data to network layer.
  2. Fragmentation is done when network layer is giving data to data link layer.
  3. CRC can detect errors easily only when the data size is large.
  4. None of these

Which of following is true with respect to port number and protocol field of transport protocol and IP protocol?

  1. Application layer protocols like HTTP, DNS, SMTP, FTP can be identified and distinguished by protocol field of IP protocol.
  2. Application layer protocols like HTTP, DNS, SMTP, FTP can be identified and distinguished by port address of transport layer.
  3. Transport layer protocols like TCP, UDP and Network layer protocol like IP, ICMP, RARP can be distinguished by protocol field of IP protocol.
  4. Transport layer protocols like TCP, UDP and Network layer protocol like IP, ICMP, RARP can be distinguished by port number of transport layer.

The correct order of calculations at sender side while transmitting data to receiver in network?

  1. TCP checksum for segment, CRC calculation for frame, IP header calculation.
  2. TCP checksum for segment, IP header calculation, CRC calculation for frame.
  3. CRC calculation for frame, IP header calculation, TCP checksum for segment.
  4. None of these

Which of following is true in case of network protocols?

  1. The sequence number of segment is (100 –199). So it is SYN segment.

  2. The sequence number of segment is m the sequence number of subsequent segment must be m + 1.

  3. Packet encapsulate segment.
  4. None of these

Which sequence number is not possible for a byte in a TCP protocol?

  1. 0

  2. 232 – 1

  3. 232 + 1

  4. 65534

Which of following is true with respect to networking protocols?

  1. TCP does not support transmitting back to back segments.
  2. HLEN bits of 0100 in IP protocol is a valid possibility.
  3. TTL value will change for packets at every hop from end to end in internet.
  4. None of these

Consider an IP packet with a length of 4500 bytes that includes 20 byte IPv4 header and 40 bytes TCP header. The packet is forwarded to an IPv4 router that supports a MTU of 600 bytes. Assume that the length of IP header in all the outgoing fragments of this packet is 20 bytes. Assume that the fragmentation offset stored in first fragment is 0.
The fragmentation offset stored in third fragment is ________.

  1. 144

Given window size parameter of TCP header is given as 1111111111111110.
No window scaling factor is applied in options and padding. Calculate the segment size of TCP ________ bytes.

  1. 65534

Which of following is correct with respect to transport protocol?

  1. In slow start algorithm of TCP, the increase of sender window size is based on ACK.
  2. UDP protocol is connection oriented virtually at destination with help of sequence number.
  3. Purpose of persistence timer is to overcome deadlock between client and server processes in network.
  4. UDP is unreliable and supports broadcasting.

Consider two hosts P and Q connected through a router R, the Maximum Transfer Unit (MTU) value of link between P and r is 1500 bytes and between R and Q is 820 bytes. A TCP segment of size 1400 bytes was transferred from P to Q through R with IP identification value as 0x1234. Assume that the IP header size is 20 bytes. Further, the packet is allowed to be fragmented i.e. don’t fragment (DF) flag in IP header is not set by P.
Which of following statements is/are correct?

  1. Two fragments are created at R and IP datagram size carrying second fragment is 620 bytes.
  2. If the second fragment is lost, R will resend fragment with IP identification value 0x1234.
  3. If the second fragment is lost, P is required to resend the whole TCP segment.
  4. TCP destination port can be determined by analysing only second fragment.

Computer Organization and Architecture.display_name: Subjectwise Test-3 Part Syllabus GATE 2026 CS Computer Organization and Architecture
Computer Organization and Architecture.syllabus: Complete Computer Organization and Architecture Syllabus

questions.text:
Two registers R1 and R2 with values R1 = 18 and R2 = 13 respectively. The instruction SUB R1, R2 is in memory location 5000 H. If the size of an instruction is 8 bytes, then after the execution of the instruction the value of PC and R1 will be

  1. PC = 5009 H, R1 = –5
  2. PC = 5008 H, R1 = 5
  3. PC = 5024 H, R1 = 5
  4. PC = 5000 H, R1 = 5

Consider the following table:

 
Match the Design change in cache to Effect on miss rate:
  1. P-(i), Q-(ii), R-(iii)
  2. P-(ii), Q-(i), R-(iii)
  3. P-(i), Q-(iii), R-(ii)
  4. P-(iii), Q-(i), R-(ii)

Consider a system that support 32 bits instruction, with instruction being 1 word long the system has 70 registers, each 32 bits wide. It needs to support 200 instructions, each of which has an immediate operand in addition to two register operands. Assuming the immediate operand is a signed integer, what is the largest +ve value of the immediate operands

  1. 255
  2. 511
  3. 512
  4. 256

Consider the following statements:
S1 : Indirect address addressing mode, the address field contain the address of a memory location that holds the effective address (EA).
S2 : In direct addressing mode, the address field of the instruction contains the effective address of the operand directly.
S3 : In both direct and indirect addressing modes, the operand can be accessed without any memory reference.
Which of the following is correct?

  1. Only S1 and S2
  2. Only S2 and S3
  3. Only S1 and S3
  4. All of the above

Assume that RISC processor contain 40 global register, 30 local register. 20 In register and 20 Out register. It contain 24 register windows what is the size of register file of the processor?

  1. 1240

Which of the following method/process used by instruction scheduling technique to reduce data and control hazards?

  1. Use special hardware to detect hazard and issue instruction when possible.
  2. Schedule the execution of instruction only if there is no hazard.
  3. Compiler move the instructions around to fill the LOADBranch delay slots with meaningful instructions.
  4. If there is a hazard then stall the pipeline.

Consider the following code executed on a 2 ns CLK cycle CPU.

 
In the CPU enhancement, Load and Arithmetic instructions are enhanced with a respective speedups of 4 and 3. Performance gain of a CPU is ________? (Upto 2 decimal)
  1. 2.093

A system has 16 GB byte addressable and 512 KB direct-mapped cache with 128 bytes per block.
How many bits are required for the tag field in system.

  1. 15
  2. 14
  3. 12
  4. 16

A hypothetical control unit supports 5 groups of mutually exclusive control signals as shown below:

 
If the control unit uses vertical micro-programming, and supports 512 control words and the total size of control memory is 2048 bytes, then what is the value of X?
  1. 32
  2. 16
  3. 54
  4. 64

Consider the following statements:
S1 : The use of multiple register windows with overlap reduces memory accesses required for handling function parameters, local variables, and register saves/restores.
S2 : The use of overlapping register windows enables faster procedure calls and returns by avoiding frequent memory accesses to the stack.
Which of the above statements are correct?

  1. Only S1
  2. Only S2
  3. Both S1 and S2
  4. Neither S1 nor S2

Match List-I with List-II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

 
 
  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

A 5 stage pipelined processor resolve branch at the 4th stage, and each stage takes one clock cycle.
Branch instructions occur with probability P, branch predictions accuracy is 60% of the time, and
miss prediction incur a 3 cycle stalls, all other instruction execute in 1 cycle and cause no stalls.
The equivalent non-pipelined CPI is 5. What is the maximum value of P such the pipelined processor achieves a speedup of atleast 2.5 over the non-pipelined versions?

  1. 74.8
  2. 87.3
  3. 17.3
  4. 83.3

Which of the following statement is false?

  1. Loops in a program arises temporal locality.
  2. In set-associative mapping, a main memory block can be placed in any block of cache.
  3. Sequential execution of a program arises spatial locality.
  4. Fully-associative mapping requires associative memory for implementation.

Consider the following statements:
(a) Hardwired control unit design is not suitable in design and testing places.
(b) Horizontal micro programmed control unit design is implemented using sum of product expression on a flip-flops.
(c) Vertical micro programmed control unit allows high degree of the parallelism.
(d) In the control unit design control signals are represented in a encoding format/decoding format/SOP format.
Which of the above statements is/are true?

  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

Consider a disk having number of tracks = 510 number of sectors/track 100 and number of bytes/sector 400. Average seek time to twice of a rotational latency speed is 600 rpm. What is the average time taken to transfer 128 bytes of data from disk ________. (Upto 2 decimal places) (in millisecond)

  1. 250.32

Consider the following format:

 
Which of the following represents NaN?
  1. (7E00)H
  2. (7F20)H
  3. (7F00)H
  4. (FFA0)H

Consider the machine with a byte addressable main memory of 216 byte, block size of 16 byte and a 2 way set associative mapped cache having 210 lines. Suppose there are two bytes in main memory i.e. first byte [E01F]16 and second byte [E208]16 respectively then the difference of the set value (in decimal) between given two bytes i.e. (SET value of second byte – SET value of 1st byte) is

  1. 21
  2. 31
  3. 40
  4. 51

A program has the following characteristics: 20% of instructions are loads and 10% are stores.
The instruction cache has a miss rate of 2%, while the data cache miss rate is 5% for loads and 1% for stores. The miss penalty for both instruction and data cache is 20 clock cycles.
Calculate the average memory stall cycles per instruction.

  1. 0.62

Consider a machine with byte addressable memory of 30 bits, block size of 16 bytes and 4 way set associative cache of size 256 bytes. For choosing the block to be replaced, least recently used scheme. The number of cache misses for the following sequence of block addresses is
12, 28, 18, 15, 19, 31, 39, 15, 7, 15

  1. 8

The innermost diameter of a disk is 20 cm and outermost diameter is 40 cm. The maximum storage density of the disk is 2800 bits/cm and rpm is 5000. If CPU has 32 bit word length and machine cycle time of 0.5 μs. Find the percentage of memory cycles stolen for transferring 1 word which cycle stealing mode is used to transfer the data from the disk ________.

  1. 0.1%
  2. 22.93%
  3. 0.5%
  4. 18.65%

Consider a two level cache system. For 100 memory references, 25 misses in the first level cache, 10 misses in second level cache. Miss penalty from second level cache to main memory is 50 cycles.
If the average memory access time is 8 cycles, then the hit time of second level cache is ________ cycles. (Assume hit time of second level cache is 2 times of first level cache)

  1. 5
  2. 2
  3. 4
  4. 6

Which of the following statements is/ are correct?

  1. Register renaming is used to handle structural hazards.
  2. Register renaming minimize all register-carried Write After Read (WAR) hazards.
  3. If pipeline stages share hardware resources, the performance of the pipelined process suffers.
  4. None of these

Consider the system used to process the addition operation which takes 4 ns. Application program contain the addition of two vectors with a size of 100 elements each i.e., A[100] and B[100]. Same program is executed on an alternate system which contain 5 processing units (ALU) which are operated in parallel. Performance gain of an alternate system to run the program over the old system is ________? (Assume in the alternate system addition operation takes 6 ns)

  1. 5.24
  2. 3.64
  3. 2.45
  4. 3.33

Which of the following is incorrect for cache memory and main memory?
S1 : Dirty bit required for each cache line in write-through based cache memory.
S2 : If dirty bit of a cache block is set, then data in this block may be different than data in corresponding block in main memory.

  1. Only S1
  2. Only S2
  3. Both S1 and S2
  4. Neither S1 nor S2

Consider the following 8 stage pipeline (S1, S2, S3, S4, S5, S6, S7, S8) used to execute the following program segment. Load instruction output is available at the end of S6 stage and ALU instruction output is available in the S3 stage. Decoding takes place in ‘S2’ stage all the instructions spending 1 cycle on each stage to complete the operation, operand forwarding is used in the pipeline.

 
The number of cycles to complete the program on a pipeline system is _________.
  1. 10
  2. 12
  3. 13
  4. 15

Consider a direct cache of size 64 bytes, with block size 16 bytes and main memory is divided into blocks of 16 bytes each i.e. block 0 has address 0 to 15 so on. Consider the following program that access memory in given sequence:
1. Access address 63 through 70
2. Loop (i) 15 through 32,
(ii) 80 through 95
Jump to Loop
If cache is organized as direct cache and loop is accessed 10 times, then the hit ratio is ________.
(Assume line 0 contain address 0, 4, 8 etc. and line 1 contain address 1, 5, 7 etc. and so on.) [Upto 2 decimal places]

  1. 0.93

Consider the following statements:
S1 : In post auto-increment addressing mode, the effective address is the value in the register before the register is incremented.
S2 : Auto-increment addressing mode is not suitable for accessing elements of arrays stored in non-contiguous memory locations.
S3 : Auto-increment addressing mode is not suitable for accessing elements of arrays stored in contiguous memory locations
Which of the following is correct?

  1. Only S1 and S2
  2. Only S1 and S3
  3. Only S2 and S3
  4. All of the above

Consider a system employing interrupt driven I/O for a particular device that transfer data at an average of 8 KB/sec on a continuous basis. Consider interrupt processing takes about 100 μsec i.e. time to jump to ISR, execute it and return to main program. The fraction of processor time consumed by this I/O device if interrupts occur for every byte is ________. (Upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 0.8

Consider a hypothetical CPU which supports X, Y and Z types of instructions. X instruction is 1-Addr register reference instruction, Y instruction is 1-Addr memory reference instruction and Z instruction is 1-Addr immediate instruction with 3 bits constant. System supports 20 bits instruction, 64 registers and 4 KB memory. If there exists 120 X instruction and 254 Y instruction then number of Z instruction will be ________?

  1. 64

Consider an instruction pipeline with five stages (S1, S2, S3, S4 and S5) each with combinational circuit only. The pipeline registers are required between each stage. Delay for the stages and for the pipeline registers are as given in the figure.

 
What is the approximate speed up of the pipeline in steady state under ideal conditions when compared to the corresponding non-pipeline implementation? (Upto 1 decimal place)
  1. 3.5

Given the following statements, which statements is/are true?

  1. Capacity of main memory depends on number of address pin.
  2. Word length depends on number of control pin.
  3. Word length depends on number of data pin.
  4. Capacity of main memory depends on number of data pin.

Consider a hypothetical CPU which supports 14 bit opcode and uses 2-address instruction. The register file has 120 registers. The main memory size is 128 KB. When the instruction is designed with indexed addressing mode, then 10 bit constant is present in the address field.
What is the size of instruction (in bits) when the instruction Address1 uses register AM and Address2 indexed AM without base register.

  1. 38
  2. 36
  3. 28
  4. 24

Suppose that in 1000 memory references there are 200 misses in first level and 100 miss in second level cache. Assume that miss penalty from L2 cache memory to memory is 100 cycles.
The hit time of L2 cache is 40 cycles. If there are 4 memory reference per instruction, the average stall per instruction is ________ cycles.

  1. 36
  2. 72
  3. 18
  4. 108

Computer Organization and Architecture.display_name: Topicwise Test-5 Part Syllabus GATE 2026 CS Computer Organization and Architecture1
Computer Organization and Architecture.syllabus: Complete Computer Organization and Architecture Syllabus

questions.text:
A CPU has 24 bits instructions and memory is byte addressable.
Consider the following below code:

 
If Branch == 0, X[PC] is supposed to skip the loop and go directly to MOV R2, SUM what should be value of X.
  1. 9

Match List-I (Characteristics) with List-II (Processors) and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

 
  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

Consider the following format:

 
 
What is the Hexa decimal equivalent in the memory after adding the following data.
1.1011001000 * 2+8
1.0010100011 * 2+4
  1. (DF12)H
  2. (5F12)H
  3. (612F)H
  4. (F125)H

Consider a 32 bits hypothetical CPU which supports instruction with 2 register operands, memory operands and 2 immediate constant fields. System supports 100 instructions, 60 registers with a register wide of 32 bits, 4 MB RAM and 13 bits constant size. Program contain 240 Instructions.
Number of bytes required to stored the program is _________.

  1. 2010
  2. 2160
  3. 2400
  4. 1620

Consider a hypothetical CPU which supports 200 instructions with a CPI of 13. Hardware contain 300 control signals, 16 flags and uses 24 branch conditions. Micro instruction is designed with 6 control signals. Size of a CDR register in the control unit design is ________ (in bits)?

  1. 75

Consider 3 ns CLK cycle CPU which consumes 4 cycles for data transfer instruction, 8 cycles for ALU instruction. 6 cycles for branch instruction, relative frequencies of these instructions are 30%, 60% and 10% respectively. System is enhanced with a respective speedups of 2, 1.6 and 2. Performance gain of an enhanced system is ________?

  1. 1.69

Consider 16 bits CPU used to execute the following code.
System supports 1 word opcode and 2 word address @ symbol uses indirect AM, [ ] symbol uses direct AM. Register R2 is designated as index register. Following code is used to execute in the
CPU. Instruction follows the standard syntax.

 
Number of memory references required to access the data is ________ where instructions are executed 5 times in the code.
  1. 45

Consider 1 GHz clock frequency processor, uses different operand access modes shown below:

Assume that 8 cycle consumed for memory reference, 4 cycles consumed for arithmetic computation and 0 cycles consumed when the operand is in register instruction itself. What is the average operand fetch rate (in million words/sec) of the processor?

  1. 117.45 M words/sec
  2. 113.63 M words/sec
  3. 217.45 M words/sec
  4. 316.45 M words/sec

Consider the following sequence of instructions:

 
The ALU operation instruction size are 32 bits, data transfer instructions are 64 bits and branch instruction size are 16 bits.
Assume the program is loaded into memory starting at address 4000 (decimal). If an interrupt occurs during the execution of the HALT instruction, what is the return address pushed onto the stack?
  1. 4019
  2. 4023
  3. 4024
  4. 4033

The following assembly code is to be executed in a 3-stage pipelined processor with hazard detection and resolution in each stage. The stage are IF, OF (one or more as required) and execution (including write-back operation). What are the number of possible RAW, WAW and WAR  hazards in the execution of the code.

 
  1. 6, 1, 2
  2. 5, 3, 3
  3. 5, 3, 2
  4. 3, 1, 2

Consider the following machine instruction:

 
 
Four stage pipeline, IF (fetch), ID (decode and operand fetch), IE (execute), WB (write back), are used. No data forwarding is present in the pipeline [Each operation takes one cycle in pipeline].
Which one of the following is true?
  1. have structural dependency and have WAR dependency.
  2. have RAW dependency, but it will not create any hazard in pipeline.
  3. causes stalls in the pipeline to maintain data integrity.
  4. There are 2 RAW dependencies and one WAW dependency in the pipeline.

Consider the following code executed on a 32 bits hypothetical CPU, stored in the memory with a starting address of (4000)10. CPU cycle time is 2 ns. Each instruction on average takes 5 cycles to complete. Interrupt sub program takes 20 cycles to complete.

 
In the program execution interrupt occurred, during the execution of ADD instruction and MUL instruction. What is the program execution time in (ns)?
  1. 70 ns
  2. 160 ns
  3. 150 ns
  4. 190 ns

Consider the following format:

 
Which of the following represents the value (> 16)10.
  1. 0 100011 110100000
  2. 0 011110 001011111
  3. 0 100010 0000100111
  4. 0 100100 001010000

Consider the following statements:
S1 : Relative addressing mode is best suited for calculate the target address in a branch instruction.
S2 : Immediate addressing mode is best suited for specifying the target address in a branch instruction.
S3 : Base register addressing mode can be used in branch instructions where the target segment base address is stored in a register.
Which of the following is correct?

  1. Only S1 and S2
  2. Only S1 and S3
  3. Only S2 and S3
  4. All S1, S2 and S3

Consider 5-stage pipeline with stage delays as 150, 120, 160, 180 and 140 ns respectively. Registers that are used between every two stages have a delay of 5 ns each. The total time taken to process 1000 data items on this pipeline will be ________ (in μsec up to 2 decimal places).

  1. 185.74

Consider 4 stage instruction pipeline executed on a system:

 
If all instructions are executed only once, what is the throughput of system?

Consider the following pipeline design:

 
Which of the following statements are correct?
  1. Pipeline cycle time is 12 ns.
  2. Pipeline cycle time is 14 ns.
  3. Pipeline takes 14 ns to complete the instruction when very large number of instructions are executed in the pipeline.
  4. Pipeline takes 1456 ns time to complete 100 instructions.

Computer Organization and Architecture.display_name: Topicwise Test-6 Part Syllabus GATE 2026 CS Computer Organization and Architecture -2
Computer Organization and Architecture.syllabus: Complete Computer Organization and Architecture Syllabus

questions.text:
Consider the following statements:
S1 : In write back protocol, cache location and main memory location are updated simultaneously.
S2 : Modified or dirty bits are used by write through protocol.
Which of the following is false?

  1. Only S1
  2. Only S2
  3. Both S1 and S2
  4. Neither S1 nor S2

Suppose that in 1200 memory references, there are 240 misses in the first-level cache and 60 misses in the second-level cache.
Assume that miss penalty from L2 cache to main memory is 120 cycles, and the hit time of the L2 cache is 30 cycles.
If there are 3 memory references per instruction, the average stall per instruction is ________ cycles.

  1. 36

Consider a two-way set associative cache with total of 8 cache blocks and the following sequence of memory block requests arrived:
20, 17, 21, 32, 20, 16, 27, 22, 7, 16, 32
If LRU replacement policy is used then the hit ratio will be ________. (Upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 0.18

Consider the following statements:
S1 : Direct mapped caches do not need a cache block replacement policy, where as fully associative cache need.
S2 : Direct mapped cache, may produce more misses if programs refers to memory words that occupy a same tag value.
Which of the following options is correct?

  1. Only S1 is true
  2. Only S2 is true
  3. Both S1 and S2 are true
  4. Neither of S1 nor S2 is true

Consider m-way set associative cache with 32-bit addresses and having block size 128 Bytes. If cache memory has 1024 blocks and TAG bits are 17, then what is the number of sets and associativity of cache?

  1. 128 sets, 8-way set associativity
  2. 256 sets, 4-way set associativity
  3. 256 sets, 8-way set associativity
  4. Cannot be determined

Consider a disk that rotates at 60000 rotations per minute and has a transfer rate of 80 MBps. If the average seek time of the disk is twice the average rotational delay and the controller’s transfer time is 8 times the disk transfer time, the average time to read or write a 128 byte sector of the disk is ________ msec. (Upto 4 decimal places)

  1. 1.5128

Consider cache memory with an access time of 50 ns having hit ratio of 70%. Miss penalty of a cache is 300 ns. Average memory access time is ________ (ns)?

  1. 140 ns
  2. 125 ns
  3. 110 ns
  4. 135 ns

Consider a hypothetical computer system which has DMA support. The DMA module transfer one 16-bit character in one CPU cycle from a device to memory through cycle stealing mode at regular intervals. Consider a 4 MHz processor. If 0.4% of processor cycles are used for DMA, the data transfer rate of the device is ________ bytes per second.

  1. 32000

Consider the following statements:
S1 : If compulsory misses are more common then the designers should consider increasing the cache line size to take better advantage of locality.
S2 : If capacity misses are most common then the designer should consider increasing the total cache size so it can contain more lines.
S3 : If conflict misses are most common then the designer should increases the cache’s associatively, in order to provide more flexibility when collision occur.
Which of the above statements are true, with respect to reducing number of cache misses.

  1. Only S2 is true
  2. Only S3 is true
  3. Both S1 and S2 are true
  4. All the statements are true

A cache memory provides a speed up of 7.27 over main memory. If the cache is 40 times faster than main memory, what percentage of total execution time is spent accessing the cache?

  1. 82%
  2. 85%
  3. 88%
  4. 90%

Which of the following statements is/are correct?

  1. Polling increases CPU overhead because the processor continuously checks device status, even if no device needs service.
  2. In polling, control is initiated by the peripheral device to notify the CPU when it is ready.
  3. During DMA transfers, the CPU is momentarily halted while the DMA controller takes control of the system bus.
  4. The DMA controller communicates directly with memory without involving the CPU for each data word transfer.

Consider a 2-way set associative cache with 8 cache blocks. If the memory block requests are accessed 2 time in the following order 0, 4, 8, 4, 0, 4, 8, 4, 3, 15, 19, 15, 3, 15, 19, 15. If LRU replacement policy is used, then the total number of misses are ________.

  1. 18

A 8 way set associative cache of 128 KB is organized with 64 byte blocks. The main memory size is 4 GB. Each line in a set has 1 valid bit, 1 dirty bit and 3 replacement bits along with a tag. How much tag directory space is present in the cache controller. (In K bits)

  1. 42
  2. 46
  3. 44
  4. 36

Consider cache memory with a hit ratio of 80% having access time of 40 ns. Access time of a main memory is 5 times of a cache memory access time.
What is the average memory access time?

  1. 72 ns
  2. 92 ns
  3. 80 ns
  4. 68 ns

Consider 4 MBPS IO device connected to 64 bits CPU using DMA interface. 64 words data is transferred from the IO to memory using DMA interface main memory machine cycle time is 0.5 micro sec. Percentage of CPU time consumed in he DMA operation is ________.

  1. 25
  2. 20
  3. 4
  4. 80

Which of the following statement are false?

  1. DMA controller is initialized by the I/O device for number of bytes to be transferred.
  2. The DMA controller sends DMA-ACK signal to I/O device after getting DMA-REQ signal from I/O device.
  3. The DMA transfer begins after CPU relinquishes the bus control.
  4. CPU provides information about number of bytes to be transferred and memory address to DMA controller.

Consider two cache organizations:
(i) The first one is a 128 KB, 2 way set associative cache with 32 byte block size.
(ii) The second one is a 128 KB direct-mapped cache.
Both use 32 bits addressing.
A 2 to 1 multiplexer has latency of 0.5 ns and K-bit comparator has a latency of ns.
What is the difference between the hit latencies of the two cache (i.e., associative hit latency direct mapped hit latency) in nano seconds?

  1. 0.75

Computer Organization and Architecture.display_name: Topicwise Test-5 Part Syllabus GATE 2025 CS Computer Organization and Architecture-1
Computer Organization and Architecture.syllabus: Complete Computer Organization and Architecture Syllabus

questions.text:
In a 6-stage instruction pipeline, if the stages are perfectly balanced and each stage takes 1 ns to complete its operation, what is the total latency (in ns) for processing a single instruction through the pipeline?

  1. 1 ns
  2. 6 ns
  3. 12 ns
  4. 18 ns

A 5-stage instruction pipeline has an ideal CPI (Cycles Per Instruction) of 1.2. What is the pipeline efficiency?
Options:

  1. 83.33%
  2. 85.00%
  3. 87.50%
  4. 90.00%

Consider the hypothetical 16 bit CPU which supports 1 word long instruction. In the CPU, 4096 register are present and system support 32 words of a memory space; system supports 2-address memory reference instructions, “14” 1-address register reference instructions “4096”
0-address instruction value of is ________.

  1. 4

A computer system has a 16-bit instruction format. If the opcode field occupies 4 bits and the immediate operand field occupies 6 bits, what is the maximum number of bits available for specifying memory addresses in instructions of this system?

  1. 6 bits
  2. 8 bits
  3. 10 bits
  4. 12 bits

In a 5-stage instruction pipeline, each stage takes 1 ns to complete its operation. The pipeline registers introduce a delay of 0.5 ns each. What is the throughput (instructions per second) of the pipeline?

  1. 200 MIPS
  2. 400 MIPS
  3. 667.67 MIPS
  4. 800 MIPS

Consider a 4-stage instruction pipeline with a clock cycle time of 1 ns. If the pipeline is stalled due to a data hazard for every 3 out of 5 instructions, what is the effective CPI (Cycles Per Instruction) of the pipeline?

  1. 1.0
  2. 1.6
  3. 1.8
  4. 2.0

The instruction format that specifies the opcode and the memory operand’s location explicitly is known as:

  1. Register addressing mode
  2. Immediate addressing mode
  3. Direct addressing mode
  4. Indirect addressing mode

A computer system uses a 32-bit instruction format. If the opcode field is 6 bits wide, and the addressing mode field is 4 bits wide, what is the maximum number of memory locations that can be accessible by the instruction.

  1. 226
  2. 222
  3. 230
  4. 232

3 stage pipelined processor having a delay of 10 ns, 20 ns, 14 ns, for the 1st, 2nd and 3rd stages respectively. Assume there is no buffer delay and processor does not suffer from pipeline hazards. Assume 1 instruction is fetched on every cycle. The total execution time for 100 instruction on this processor is ________ ns.

  1. 2040

In a computer system, the instruction format consists of 32 bits. The register operand field is 6 bits wide, and the remaining bits are used for specifying memory addresses and opcode field. If the memory address width is such that it can represent up to 216 different memory locations, what is the maximum number of instructions that can be possible in the instruction set of this computer system?

  1. 210
  2. 212
  3. 216
  4. 220

Consider 8-stage pipeline which allows all instructions except memory reference instruction.
Memory reference instruction penalty is 6 cycles. Program contain 30% memory reference instruction what the performance gain ________?

  1. 2.85

Which of the following addressing modes allows the operand to be specified explicitly within the instruction?

  1. Direct addressing mode
  2. Indirect addressing mode
  3. Immediate addressing mode
  4. Indexed addressing mode

Consider the following statements and identify the false statements.

  1. PC increment to step size after access every word of the instruction until complete access of instruction from the memory.
  2. CPU respond to the interrupt immediately, when it occurs.
  3. EA is used the IF, OF and WB stages of an instruction cycle.
  4. During the executing of a CALL instruction, first update the PC later push the PC value into a stack.

Which addressing mode involves using a register to indirectly access memory?

  1. Register indirect addressing mode
  2. Base addressing mode
  3. Stack addressing mode
  4. Direct addressing mode

Consider 8 bit CPU with 16 MB main memory. Instruction is designed with 2 word opcode which include addressing modes. Instruction uses 2-address format where address-1 (S1 and D) uses indirect addressing mode and address-2 (S2) uses direct AM. Opcode is designed with ALU operation i.e.

Instruction is stored in the memory location (400000)H on words. Number of memory reference are required to complete the instruction is ________.

  1. 17

A computer system uses an addressing mode that specifies the memory address as the sum of a base register value and a signed offset. If the base register contains the hexadecimal value 0×8000 and the offset is –0×200, what is the effective memory address in hexadecimal format?

  1. 0×7800
  2. 0×7E00
  3. 0×7E80
  4. 0×7FF0

In a computer system with a 5-stage RISC instruction pipeline consisting of Instruction Fetch (IF), Instruction Decode (ID), Execute (EX), Memory Access (MEM), and Register Write (WB) stages, which of the following statements is true?

  1. The IF stage is responsible for decoding the instruction opcode.
  2. The ID stage is responsible for fetching the instruction from memory.
  3. The EX stage is responsible for accessing data from memory.
  4. The WB stage is responsible for writing the result of the operation back to a register.
