questions.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct?
S1 : Memory and devices have their own separate buses in addressing mode.
S2 : The isolated method isolated memory and address so that memory address range is not affected by interface addressing assignment.

  1. Only S1

  2. Only S2

  3. Both S1 and S2

  4. Neither S1 nor S2

Match List-I with List-II and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

Consider a processor with 4 byte jump instruction is encountered at memory address 4096. If the jump instruction is in PC relative mode and instruction at memory address 4096 is jump –15 (where –15 is signed byte) then what is the branch target address? All the addresses are in the decimal.

  1. 4081
  2. 4096
  3. 5000
  4. 4985

Which of the following is correct about vectored interrupt?

  1. Interrupt vector gives the branch address of an interrupting device.
  2. Branch address is always assigned to a fixed memory location.
  3. Polling technique is used to transfer the branch information.
  4. None of these

Consider a system with an instruction set that uses a fixed 19 bit instruction length and 8 bit address length. If there exist ‘6’ two-address instructions and ‘K’ one-address instructions. What is the maximum value of K, if the number of zero address instruction is 65536?

  1. 256

Which of the following statements is/are correct?
S1 : CPU takes care of the operation in the programmed modes because the devices are directly connected to the system bus.
S2 : DMA techniques is more efficient than the interrupt-driven technique for high volume data transfer.

  1. Only S1

  2. Only S2

  3. Both S1 and S2

  4. None of these

Consider a micro-programmed control unit which supports 540 instructions, each instruction takes 30 micro operations, if 22 flags and 72 control signal are supported vertical micro-programmed is used then the size of 4 control word is ________ (in Bytes).

  1. 13

Match List-I (Dependency) with List-II (Instruction) and select the correct answer using the codes given below the lists:

  1. a
  2. b
  3. c
  4. d

A 6 stage pipeline has the stage delay, 80 ns, 100 ns, 120 ns, 150 ns, 180 ns, 220 ns respectively registers that are used between the stages have a delay of 5 ns each. Assuming constant clock rate, the total time to process 740 data item on this pipeline will be ________ (in microsecond).
(Upto 1 decimal place)

  1. 163.9 [163.7 - 163.10]

Which of the following statement is/are correct?

  1. Capacity miss can be reduced by the increasing the cache size.
  2. The search concept used in associative memory in parallel search.
  3. Conflict miss can be reduced by the increasing cache size.
  4. Reducing block size will impact the spatial locality.

Consider an enhancement to the processor of web application. The enhanced CPU is 60 times faster on search acquires than old processors. Old processor is busy with search queries 85% of the time. Then the speed up gained by integrating the enhanced CPU is ________.

  1. 4.27
  2. 2.89
  3. 6.09
  4. 4.58

Assume that RISC processor contain 30 global registers, 20 local registers 10 in-register and 10 out-register. It contain 4 register window what is difference between the size of register file of the processor and window size?

  1. 80
Suppose 2-way set associative cache with 2m lines 2p bytes per cache lines. Memory is byte addressable of 2n bytes. What is the space required for storing tags (in bits)?

Consider the following statements:
S1 : Delay control transfer involve starting the execution of the instruction after a branch or control instruction regardless of whether the branch is taken.
S2 : A way to implement branch prediction is to store the result of a branch condition in a branch target buffer.
S3 : If, a multi-cycle, pipelined processor has ‘N’ pipeline stages, then structural hazards can be avoided completely if at least ‘N’ registers are available.
Which of the above statements are true?

  1. S1 only

  2. S1 and S2 only

  3. S1 and S3 only

  4. All of these

Consider the following program codes:

Assume the data transfer instruction size is 40 bit, ALU operation instruction size 32 bit and branch instruction size is 16 bit. The program starts from the location 8000 decimal onwards. Assume if the interrupt occurs during the execution of the return address pushed onto the stack is ________.

  1. 8026

A non-pipeline processor has a clock rate 4 MHz and average CPI of 5. An upgrade to the processor introduce 5 stage pipeline. How ever due to internal delay the clock rate of the new processor has to be reduces to 3 MHz. What is the speed-up of pipeline over non-pipeline?

  1. 3.7
  2. 3.1
  3. 3.5
  4. 4.2

Consider a system with 8-way set associative data cache size is 128 Kbytes and block size 16 bytes. The cache is managed using 32 bit virtual address and page size is 4 K bytes. What is the total size of the tags in the cache directory ________ (K bits).

  1. 144

Consider an “old” computer with 4 GHz of clock rate takes 60 seconds to execute a program completely. If program is modified such that it will take 2.4 times of clock cycles of old CPU and it executed on new/upgraded computer, then it takes 16 seconds to execute same program. The clock rate of upgraded computer is ________ (in GHz).

  1. 36 GHz
  2. 24 GHz
  3. 48 GHz
  4. 16 GHz

Consider the system with a byte addressable main memory of 64 Kbytes, block size of 16 bytes and 2-way set associative mapped cache having 1 K lines. Suppose there are two bytes in main memory i.e., first byte [E20D]16 and second byte [E408]16 respectively then the difference of the
set value (in decimal) between given two bytes i.e., (SET value of second byte – SET value of first byte) is

  1. 31
  2. 32
  3. 64
  4. 63

Consider a 8 stage pipeline which allows overlapping of all instruction except memory based instructions penalty of the memory based instruction is 6 cycles. In the program 30% memory instructions are present among them 70% are optimized. What is the average instruction execution time?

(Assuming the pipeline cycles time as 12 ns)

  1. 18.48

Consider the following instruction sequence with there meaning given below:

What is the number of Write After Read (WAR) and Write After Write (WAW) hazards for the above instruction sequence?

  1. 2, 0
  2. 1, 3
  3. 2, 2
  4. 3, 1

Which of the following statements is/are correct?

  1. Horizontal micro-instruction have a higher degree of parallelism than vertical micro-instruction.
  2. Horizontal micro-instruction support slower execution compared to vertical micro-instruction.
  3. Vertical micro-instruction support control signals expressed in encoded binary format.
  4. Vertical micro-instruction are used in CISC.

Consider a system with the main memory access time as 750 ns and cache access time as 50 ns. Hit ratio for read request is 0.7 and 60% of the memory request are for read. If write through policy is used, then the average time (considering both read and write request) is ________ (in nanosec).
(Upto 1 decimal place)

  1. 456

A hard disk has 32 recording surfaces, 256 cylinders, 512 sectors per track and sector size is 1 KB.
Find the total size of this hard disk in GB ________.

  1. 4

Consider the following floating point format:

The single precision normalized value DEC80000, has equivalent decimal number representation is P × 250.

  1. -6400

Which of the following statements is true?
S1 : For two level memory hierarchy cache and main memory. WRITE THROUGH result in more number write cycles to main memory than WRITE BACK.
S2 : Write back protocol, cache memory and main memory location are update simultaneously.
S3 : Modify or Dirty bit are used by write back protocol.

  1. Only S1 and S2

  2. Only S2 and S3

  3. OnlyS1 and S3

  4. None of these

Consider the following statements:
S1 : Direct mapped cache do not need a cache block replacement policy, where as fully associative cache need.
S2 : The main advantage of direct mapping is that the cache hit ratio increases drastically if two or more frequently used block map into same region.
Which of the following options is correct?

  1. Only S1

  2. Both S1 and S2

  3. Only S2

  4. None of these

Consider a disk drive with the following specifications. 16 surfaces, 128 tracks/surfaces, 256 sectors/ tracks, 512 B/sector, rotations speed 3600 rpm. The disk is operated in cycle stealing mode where by whenever one byte word is ready it is sent to memory, similarly for writing. The disk interface
reads a 5 byte word from the memory in each DMA cycle. Memory cycle time is 50 μsec. The maximum percentage of time that the CPU gets blocked during DMA operation is ________. (Upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 28.40

Consider a P-way set associative cache consisting of 2048 line with line offset of 64 words. The number of TAG, bits 10, 9 . If the CPU generates 25 bits address of a word then value of P is ________.

  1. 4

Consider a 5 GHz clock frequency processor used to executed the following program segment on a pipelined processor:

Each memory references and ALU operations consumes 3 cycles and 1 cycle respectively. The total time required to complete the program execution is

  1. 13.2
  2. 14.2
  3. 14.6
  4. 13.4

A program consists of mainly different types of instructions. The table for instruction type, Cycle Per Instruction (CPI) and frequency of such instruction in the program is given below:

The average CPI of the program is ________. (Upto 2 decimal places)

  1. 2.92

Which of the following is/are true for Reduced Instruction Set Computer (RISC)?

  1. More number of registers compared to CISC
  2. Hardwired control unit
  3. Fixed length instruction
  4. More address mode (AM) compared to CISC

Consider the following sequence of instructions executed on a 5 stage pipelined processor. Data dependency is resolved by operand forwarding techniques. MOV instruction output present in 4th stage and ALU operation output present in 3rd stage.

What is the number of cycles required to complete the program? (Assume each stage takes 1 cycle time)

  1. 8
  2. 9
  3. 10
  4. 11

questions.text:
Consider 4 MBPS IO devices connected to 64 bit CPU using DMA interface. 64 words data is transfer from the IO to memory using DMA interface. Main memory machine cycle time is 0.5 microsecond percentage of CPU time consumed in the DMA operation is ________ (in %).

  1. 20

What is the range of exponents possible in the following hypothetical floating point data.

  1. –2047 to +2048
  2. –2048 to +2049
  3. –2047 to +2046
  4. –2048 to +2047

Which of the following best describes the purpose of cache memory in a computer system?

  1. To provide long-term storage for the operating system.
  2. To store frequently accessed instructions and data for faster access.
  3. To manage the input/output operations between the processor and main memory.
  4. To facilitate communication between the processor and peripheral devices.

A computer system has a cache memory with a hit ratio of 95% and a access time of 1 ns. If the miss penalty is 10 ns, what is the effective access time of the cache memory?

  1. 1.05 ns
  2. 1.45 ns
  3. 2 ns
  4. 3 ns

What is the primary function of the data-path in a computer system?

  1. To control the flow of instructions between the processor and memory.
  2. To store and retrieve data from the cache memory.
  3. To provide a pathway for data transfer between different components of the processor.
  4. To manage the input/output operations of the computer system.

In a computer system, the data-path consists of 16 registers, each capable of storing 32 bits. If each register has an individual address, what is the total storage capacity (in bits) of the register file?

  1. 16 bits
  2. 32 bits
  3. 512 bits
  4. 1024 bits

Consider 8 way set associative cache of 256 KB organized into a 64 B blocks. CPU generates 24 bit physical address to access the data. In the cache controller each tag is comprising of 1 valid bit and 1 update bit which of the following statement are true.
I. Each lines of a cache set contain 9 bit tag space.
II. 44 K bit tag directory is present in the cache controller.
III. (FE2484)H main memory addressed data is present in set (146)10.
IV. In each set of a cache, 512 different main memory blocks are possible to map.

  1. I, II, III are true
  2. II, III are true
  3. III, IV are true
  4. All are true

Main memory access time is 100 ns, while the cache access time is 10 ns. If the hit ratio of the cache is 90%, what is the average access time of the memory system?

  1. 10 ns
  2. 19 ns
  3. 19.9 ns
  4. 20 ns

Which of the following components is responsible for storing intermediate results and operands during instruction execution?

  1. Control unit
  2. Cache memory
  3. Registers
  4. Secondary storage

A computer system has an ALU that performs arithmetic operations using 2’s complement representation. If the ALU operates on 8-bit data, what is the largest positive number that can be represented using the ALU?

  1. 27 – 1
  2. 27
  3. 28 – 1
  4. 28

Consider 4-way set associative cache of 32 KB organized into a 32 word blocks used in the 32 bit CPU to which cache set (in decimal) the following main memory addressed data is mapped in the cache.
Main memory address 0xFCB82680

  1. 13

A computer system has a cache memory with a hit ratio of 98% and an access time of 2 ns. If the miss penalty is 20 ns, what is the effective access time of the cache memory?

  1. 2.36 ns
  2. 2.5 ns
  3. 2.6 ns
  4. 2.6 ns

Consider direct mapped cache of 2 KB organized into a 512 byte blocks. Following main memory blocks are referred by the CPU during the program execution:
3, 8, 7, 2, 1, 4, 3, 5, 4, 3, 7, 4, 8
Which of the following statement are true?
I. Number of compulsory misses are 7.
II. Hit ratio of program is 0.23.
III. Number of conflict misses are 3.
IV. Block 2 is not replaced by any other blocks in the cache.

  1. I and II are false
  2. I and III are true
  3. I, II and II are false
  4. All are true

Consider a system with hit ratio of a cache and main memory are 70% and 90% respectively cache memory access times is 60 ns. When miss in cache then 8 word block is transferred from main memory to cache. Main memory access time per word is 50 ns. When miss in main memory then 16 word page is transferred from secondary memory to main memory. Secondary memory access time per word is 100 ns. Average memory access time is ________ (in ns).

  1. 228

In a computer system, the ALU takes 2 clock cycles to perform an addition operation and 3 clock cycles to perform a multiplication operation. If the system clock runs at a frequency of 2 GHz, what is the throughput (in operations per second) of the computer if program contain 50% addition and 50% multiplication operations are present.

  1. 0.8 × 109 operations/s

  2. 0.75 × 109 operations/s

  3. 1.0 × 109 operations/s

  4. 1.5 × 109 operations/s

A hard disk with a transfer rate of 10 M bytes/second is constantly transferring data to memory using DMA. The processor runs at 600 MHz and takes 300 and 900 clock cycles to initiate and complete DMA transfer respectively. If the size of the transfer is 20 Kbytes, what is the percentage of processor time consumed for the transfer operation?a

 

  1. 5.0%
  2. 1.0%
  3. 0.5%
  4. 0.1%

A computer system employs a memory hierarchy consisting of a cache memory with an access time of 5 ns, and main memory with an access time of 50 ns. If the hit ratio of the cache is 90%, what is the average access time of the memory system?

  1. 14.5 ns
  2. 16 ns
  3. 10
  4. 25 ns

questions.text:
Out of given alternatives, choose the one which best expresses the meaning of the word, Envoy

  1. Carrier
  2. Chief
  3. Ambassador
  4. Receiver

Choose the word opposite in meaning for the underlined word:
The hot summer afternoon made everyone feel languid and they sought refuge in the shade to escape the heat.

  1. Listless
  2. Energetic
  3. Lethargic
  4. Sluggish

Select the part (option) of the below sentence that contains an error :
He was consulted seldom by his colleagues while making important decisions on financial matters.

  1. He was consulted seldom
  2. Decisions on financial matters
  3. By his colleagues
  4. While making important

Select the alternative which is the best substitute of the sentence/word:
Take away or alter the natural qualities of

  1. Denature
  2. Unadulterated
  3. Authentic
  4. Limpid

If MOBILE is written as ZAMSUM, how TUMOR can be written in that code?

  1. BRAIN
  2. HGYAD
  3. GGXYA
  4. IHZBE

If × stands for addition, < for subtraction, + for division, > for multiplication, – for equal to, ÷ for greater than and = for less than, state which of the following expressions is true?

  1. 3 × 2 < 4 ÷ 16 > 2 + 4
  2. 5 > 8 + 4 = 10 < 4 × 2
  3. 3 × 4 > 2 – 9 + 3 < 3
  4. 5 × 3 × 3 ÷ 8 + 4 × 1

In the given diagram, circle represents professionals, square represents dancers, triangle represents musicians and rectangle represents Europeans. Different regions in the diagram are numbered 1 to 11. Who among the following is neither a dancer nor a musician but is professional and not a European?

 
  1. 8
  2. 11
  3. 1
  4. 10

In the following question, the passage/sentence is split into four parts A, B, C and D. These four parts are not given in their proper order. Read the sentence and find out which of the following four combinations is correct.
A. Explained angrily
B. The bricklayer
C. Leaving the site
D. His reasons for

  1. BADC
  2. DCAB
  3. CBAD
  4. ADCB

Choose the correct alternative to fill in the blank in the sentence given below.
Today student should be reconciled _____ the way things are changing.

  1. with
  2. to
  3. for
  4. at

The World Health Organisation is briefly called W.H.O. It is a specialised agency of the United Nations and was established in 1948.  International health workers can be seen working in all kinds of surroundings: in deserts, jungles, mountains, coconut groves, and rice fields. They help the sick to attain health and the healthy to maintain their health. This global health team assists the local health workers in stopping the spread of what are called communicable diseases, like cholera. These diseases can spread from one country to another and so can be a threat to world health. W.H.O. assists different national health authorities not only in controlling diseases but also in preventing them altogether. Total prevention of diseases is possible in a number of ways. Everyone knows how people, particularly children, are vaccinated against one disease or another. Similarly, most people are familiar with the spraying of houses with poisonous substances which kill disease-carrying insects.
"It is a specialised agency of the United Nations and was established in 1948.” Here specialised means

  1. expert
  2. extraordinary
  3. uncommon
  4. made suitable for a particular purpose

Select the related word from the given alternatives that fits the analogy:
Horse : Neigh :: Bells : ?

  1. Beat
  2. Chime
  3. Rustle
  4. Roar

In questions no. 12 and 13, one/two statements are given followed by two/three conclusions. You have to consider the statements to be true even if they seem to be at variance from commonly known facts. You have to decide which of the given conclusions, if any, follows from the given statements.

Statement:
Sun is the source of light.
Conclusions:
I. Moon is not the source of light
II. Light has only one source.

  1. Only conclusion (I) follows
  2. Only conclusion (II) follows
  3. Both conclusions (I) and (II) follow
  4. Neither conclusion (I) nor (II) follows

Statement:
I. All cities are towns.
II. Some cities are villages.
Conclusions:
I. All villages are towns.
II. No village is a town.
III. Some villages are towns.

  1. Only conclusion (III) follows
  2. Only conclusion (I) follows
  3. Only conclusion (II) follows
  4. None of these
Which one of the following diagrams best depicts the relationship among Earth, Sea and Sun?

If ‘PUNCTUATION’ is coded as ‘QVODUVBUJPO’ and ‘SING’ as ‘TJOH’, then how is ‘PARLIAMENT’ coded?

  1. QBSMJKNFMU
  2. QBSMJBNFOU
  3. QTBSMJOFOU
  4. QASTMJNFOU

Arrange the following four sentences P, Q, R and S in the proper sequence to form a meaningful
paragraph starting from 1 and ending with 6.
1. Communication has been an important aspect all through the ages.
P. E-mail is a convenient way to deliver any requested information.
Q. Today instantaneous communication is vital.
R. Voice is often easier than e-mail, but it is not as easy to create and send nor is it possible to send the same message to a large number of people in different places in the world.
S. It is also a good way to communicate with multiple people at the same time; but e-mail is only one form for communication.
6. The other forms of faster and easier communication are being explored.
Which one of the following is the correct sequence?

  1. SQRP
  2. QPSR
  3. SPRQ
  4. RQSP

Select the related word from the given alternatives that fits the analogy.
FLEXIBLE : RIGID : : CONFIDENCE : ?

  1. Diffidence
  2. Indifference
  3. Cowardice
  4. Scare

In a certain office,  of the workers are women,  of the women are married and  married women have children,  of men are married and  of married man have children, the percentage of workers without children is

  1. 37.27%
  2. 61.11%
  3. 72.22%
  4. 87.27%
The average monthly income of P and Q is The average monthly income of Q and R is and the average monthly income of P and R is The monthly income of Q is

The sum of four numbers is 64. If you add 3 to the first number, 3 is subtracted from the second number, the third is multiplied by 3 and the fourth is divided by 3, then all the results are equal. What is the difference between the largest and the smallest of the original numbers?

  1. 21
  2. 27
  3. 32
  4. Cannot be determined
The price of an article was increased by r%. Later the new price was decreased by r%. If the latest price was then the original price was

At his usual rowing rate, Rahul can travel 12 miles downstream in a certain river in 6 hours less than it takes him to travel the same distance upstream. But if he could double his usual rowing rate for his 24 mile round trip, the downstream 12 miles would then take only one hour less than the upstream 12 miles. What is the speed of the current in miles per hour?

A sum of money doubles itself at compound interest in 15 years. In how many years will it become eight times?

  1. 45
  2. 60
  3. 30
  4. 40

The value of log tan 10° + log tan 11° + log tan 12° + ...... log tan 80° is ________ .

  1. 0

The last day of a century cannot be

  1. Tuesday
  2. Thursday

After observing the Earth's weather patterns and the 11-year sunspot cycle of the Sun for 36 years, scientists have found that high levels of sunspot activity precede shifts in wind patterns that affect the Earth's weather. One can conclude that meteorologists will be able to improve their weather forecasts based on this information.
Which of the following, if true, most seriously weakens the argument above?

  1. Weather forecasts are more detailed today than they were 36 years ago.
  2. Scientists can establish that sunspot activity directly affects the Earth's weather.
  3. Evidence other than sunspot activity has previously enabled meteorologists to forecast the weather conditions that are predictable on the basis of sunspot activity.
  4. Scientists have not determined why the sunspot activity on the Sun follows an 11-year cycle.

Astronomer: Most stars are born in groups of thousands, each star in a group forming from the same parent cloud of gas. Each cloud has a unique homogeneous chemical composition. Therefore whenever two stars have the same chemical composition as each other, they must have originated from the same cloud of gas.
Which of the following, if true, would most strengthen the astronomer’s argument?

  1. In some groups of stars, not every star originated from the same parent cloud of gas.
  2. Clouds of gas of similar or identical chemical composition may be remote from each other.
  3. Whenever a star forms, it inherits the chemical composition of its parent cloud of gas.
  4. Many stars in vastly different parts of the universe are quite similar in their chemical compositions.

People tend to estimate the likelihood of an event’s occurrence according to its salience; that is, according to how strongly and how often it comes to their attention. By placement and headlines, newspapers emphasize stories about local crime over stories about crime elsewhere and about many other major events.
It can be concluded on the basis of the statements above that, if they are true, which of the following is most probably also true?

  1. The language used in newspaper headlines about local crime is inflammatory and fails to respect the rights of suspects.
  2. The press is the news medium that focuses people’s attention most strongly on local crimes.
  3. Readers of local news in newspapers tend to overestimate the amount of crime in their own localities relative to the amount of crime in other places.
  4. None of the events concerning other people that are reported in newspapers is so salient in people’s minds as their own personal experiences.
